Reviews.Title: “Standard”
Reviews.Author: Thousandeurist
Reviews.Content: It is just what you expect a Hilton to be: an old glory that still score high on customer service Rooms big, well appointed, up-to-date. no bathrooms that kept a distinctive 90's flair. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay & close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Midnightfive
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on Feb 25th to the 27th 2012. When we first came in we were greeted by the staff. The staff are very nice and always willing to help. The room is clean and comfortable. It is a little small but it was fine with us. The bathroom is spacious which I liked. The house keeper cleans your room everyday. The fitness gym is wonderful. It is in the basement. It is clean and well kept. I had an great workout. Also, it have tv for entertainment while you workout. The area of the hotel is quiet on Sundays. The hotel is close to the quincy market, downtown crossing, the aquarium, coffee shop, deli, 711, dunkin donuts, and pubs. It is literally walking distance. It is close to orange line and green line (public transportation). It was an enjoyable stay and I wish I could have stayed longer. P.S.- If you like soup, you have to try the soups from Boston Chowda at the Quincy Market! It is delicious! If you like to shop, you could walk to downtown crossing and they have Marshall's, TJ Maxx, CVS, and other stores. Chinatown is also close to that area too. Just have to walk further down. If you are planning to go to travel alot on public transportation, it is best to get the weekly pass which is 15 dollars. It is 2.00$ per a ride if you do not get the weekly pass. So calculate your how much fare you are going to use before buying.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, hotel under construction also”
Reviews.Author: hook5966
Reviews.Content: I wish there was a zero rating possible on this site for the hotel. I don't think there is enough room to list all of the issues we found with this hotel. -They got our reservation wrong. We went all the way to our room to find a king instead of the 2 doubles we had reserved. -There are reportedly 2 restaurants on site. Hotel is under construction. The only "restaurant" is in the tiny lounge. -The bartender in the lounge was unprofessionally dressed in jeans. -The security key access to take the elevators to floors with rooms does not work. You don't need any key. -Internet use is not free anywhere in the hotel, INCLUDING the business center. Yes there are fees in the business center to use internet. -Room service is only until 11pm, not 24 hours as listed on Hilton's website. -Walls are thin. -There were huge marks in the doors to our hall and room. -There was a huge stain in the carpet of our room. -The shower rod was all rusty and not hung properly. The screws were wedged into it instead of screwed through the manufactured holes. -We left the hotel at 10:30am and returned after 8pm and housekeeping had not made up our room. When we called, we were told we had a do not disturb status all day because there was a sign out between 8-10am when housekeeping looked. The sign was taken down by 10:30am, so they didn't do any follow up after that. Front desk and management tried to make excuses and blame it on us. *Positive note to Bianca, the housekeeper who was sent to our room after 9pm. She was quick, nice, and thorough. The next morning there was a phone call from housekeeping asking when we would be out. No apology for prior issue.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid.... It ruined my trip....”
Reviews.Author: paull25
Reviews.Content: As ever we read all the reviews for Hilton Boston Downtown before booking and we were slightly dubious about staying there because of the mixed reviews it got on here. We sincerly regret booking the hotel as it ruined out shortstay in Boston. We arrived late evening on day 1 of our stay and got assigned room 512..... First thing we noticed was how cold the room was.... We put the heating on high and went out for dinner. On retuning to the room we thought the room was still cold, but presumed the bed would be made up to match the -5 outside! How wrong we were, we both woke up freezing cold and as i type this i have the worst cold, not helped by our night in this room! Our first day of sightseeing in Boston was done in a tired daze down to a bad nights sleep! We requested the bed to made up with extra covers.... What we got was 2 blankets dumped at the foot of our bed! The second night was the worst of the 2 nights..... My partner luckily had earplugs, but i didnt and despite going to bed at 10pm i didnt sleep till at least 3am due to the noises from the pubs/clubs outside! Admittedly outside noise isnt the hotels fault, but they would of known how noosy our room was at the weekend, so why not warn us at check in or offer us an alternative room? As a HHonour Gold I got a free breakfast in the 'resturant' i have never been waited on in a Hilton by staff wearing jeans! The breakfast was pretty grim, nothing was labeled and a fly was crawling over the danish pastries.... Nice! The room was of a good size, but one of our 2 windows was blocked by sheeting down to the refurbishment outside! Again no warning was given! We only had 2 days in Boston and this hotel ruined our vacation! A hotel can offer a nice lobby, clean rooms with every amenity going but what it comes down to is sleep.... Something i didnt get much of at this property. Read the bad reviews and use them as a warning, there are so many great hotels in Boston and despite this hotel being a Hilton, it isn't one of them!

Reviews.Title: “Good And spacey but bit dark”
Reviews.Author: tjp1994
Reviews.Content: I have been here twice and twice I was upgraded to a suite. So no complaining, although this time they were doing works on the outside for which they apologised beforehand, so no problem. Food was not great really but staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Unbeatable Location, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Leo K
Reviews.Content: Always wanted to check out Boston, and found a great deal on this Hotel for 100 a night, which from what I hear is pretty unheard of for a good Hotel in Boston (Like in NYC) Upon checking in, we were greated at the front desk by a very friendly staff member The room looks like it was remodeled, had a flat screen, all new furniture, great bathroom, and was very clean and modern (two very important things for me) The hotel was literally minutes away from N End Boston, Union Oyster House and all the other treats Boston has to offer. It was even near 4 parking garages, where I basically paid 30 bucks for 3 days to park, which is amazing. Check out was simple at 12PM, couldn't ask for a better time to check out. Overall: Great Hotel, would stay here again, Great Location, and great staff (Boston on the other hand, might need to learn from NYC and stop closing restaurants at 10PM and bars 2AM, so hard to get used to this if your from NYC, BOSTON you are a big city get with the program!!)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl140
Reviews.Content: Having never visited Boston and being a huge fan of the Celtics, I decided to come for the weekend to see a game and stayed at this property. It is within walking distance to quite a few restaurants and a brisk 20 minute walk to the TD Garden. The staff was great (kudos to Chris at the front desk) concierge very helpful (they helped me book a trolley tour) and the gym facility sufficient. You could tell the room had been recently redone (new television, updated bathroom) but there was a bad draft coming from outside. This is no fault of the hotel but probably just the age of the hotel. Room service was quick, the hotel decent and overall I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. If I could find anything to complain about it would be with whomever they chose to renovate their walls throughout the hotel. The wallpaper was done a little tacky and could be redone but seriously, if all I have to complain about is wallpaper, that should be the least of your worries!

Reviews.Title: “Beware, under renovation...”
Reviews.Author: DJR1250
Reviews.Content: I stay at Hilton properties all the time and this is an above average property. The staff is nice, the rooms are spacious and I've stayed here several times. Just a word of warning that the exterior is under major renovation and half the exterior of the hotel is wrapped in a protectant material. This review is just a word of caution, as I was not aware of this renovation when I made my reservation. Although I love the location and WILL stay here again, I won't come back until they are done renovating the exterior. It was VERY noisy!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: jtc6996
Reviews.Content: A hotel room is a hotel room anywhere you stay. It's a small room with a bed, a chair, and a tv. So what separates the good one from the great ones? Location and service. The Hilton has both. We have small kids and wanted to be within walking distance of Faneuil Hall. The Hilton is a five minute walk to Faneuil Hall. The Service in the Hilton is exceptional. Everyone from the valet, to the doorman, to the front desk was welcoming and helpful. Try to get that at the Holiday Inn. On our second day there we we looking for an outdoor activity and received excellent help from the Consierge. The advice she gave us was the highlight of our trip.We would have never known about the free ice skating in Boston Commons. That memory alone was worth every penny. I would have given the hotel an "excellent" rating if there was a pool. That would have been the perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: GMEE4
Reviews.Content: This hotel has comfortable rooms within easy walking distance to central Boston. There was no restaurant but the bar meals were very good after a busy day sight seeing. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service ! Glad to be back!”
Reviews.Author: artieboy
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and many places fake it and take your money at full price, this is not one of those. The Front Desk staff was eager, accommodating and very helpful. The Doorman and Bell staff always had a smile and a friendly greeting every time I passed. I enjoy coming back to this hotel every year for business. - Please be aware of the Hot water irregularities. It's scalding hot at times and fluctuates without notice. DO NOT leave children untended in the shower or running the tub. I ever don't remember this being an issue but it was this time around. - The mini bars have been cleared out and can use them for your own needs. This might change but a big plus and I hope they keep it.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Get Away”
Reviews.Author: deanna46
Reviews.Content: Wonderful check in experience and very helpful people. Nice Lobby. Location was fine, quiet area on the weekends and close to nice restaurants and Quincy Market and T station. However, room was extremely small - not even room for a comfortable chair for reading - closet door did not close all the way and had a big hole in it. Room was nicely furnished but more upgrades still needed. Heard the HVAC units from the roof below us all the time and it was pretty loud at night. No restaurant on the property. We probably would not return to this particular hotel. Disappointing for Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: NapervilleCookie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Boston for a weekend getaway. We had a wonderful time. The staff at the Hilton was professional; the room well appointed; and we were able to check in a bit early. I was concerned after reading reviews of this hotel on weekends that evening noise would be a problem. We were on the 8th floor and it was quite peaceful. My one complaint is that due to renovations breakfast is being served in a conference styled room. Although the wait staff was great the room layout was mediocre and the conference styled chairs and tables seemed lackluster - a $20 plus buffet deserved a better atmosphere. All in all (and once the renovations are completed) I'd give this hotel a high "thumbs up".

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: m0mmy04
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful and very clean. A little noisy at times. (there is a bar a block or so away) The people who worked there were very friendly too. I would stay there again but maybe ask for a room not on the street side.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but very poor service!”
Reviews.Author: X-O75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite well located in the financial district with easy walking distance from Quincy Market, the port or downtown. The building is very nice and important outside work were hiding part of the view of the room...The room itself was quite standard for a Hilton hotel. The bed is confortable, the bathroom is getting old. The problem of this hotel is that there is no service, no slippers, no attention from people working there. The breakfast during the week end was very average with no service AT ALL! People just ignore you but claim for tips at the end...Very disappointing for a Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Cheers Boston Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Sovsscotland
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in Boston during September 2011, with wife and my elderly mother, for a break and to visit distant relatives. Easy access by taxi from airport, although room not ready, it was before check-in time, staff at reception very helpful, using their advice, we went for a walk around general area, to get our bearings. We were given a large, quiet suite, clean and although decor could be described as 'tired' no problems or need to seek a move. Hotel location was ideal, convenient to the shops and many bars/restaurants, with Quincy Market and quay area (where most of the tram tours are located) a short walk away, likewise with Boston Common. Staff at hotel were extremely helpful, especially the concierge team, with advice, especially on locations and how best to visit, decided to hire a car, all sorted virtually over the phone and delivered to the hotel. Overall service was good; easy check-in and check-out, recommend if staying over in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Mary N
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Saturday night while I was in town to see a Broadway tour. It's very easily accessible to the downtown shopping area, the bus station, Quincy Market, etc. It was gorgeous the weekend I was there (though a bit chilly occasionally), so I just walked everywhere I needed to be. There are a number of bars and restaurants that are open late in the area (which is, apparently, rare in the city of Boston). The room I was given was clean. It was large and the bed was extremely comfortable. My check-in was extremely easy and I was able to get a room before the official check-in time. The doorman gave me directions to the Opera House and when I returned, asked if I found it easily (I had). I ordered room service late Saturday night. My room didn't have a menu but the person who answered was patient and let me know what was available. The food arrived in less than the time they told me so I was pleasantly surprised. The only bad thing I could say about the hotel is that the walls are extremely thin - EXTREMELY. I felt like I could hear everything happening on the floor and in the rooms next to me. I was woken up around 3 in the morning to loud laughs which was annoying but I was able to fall back asleep quickly, luckily. All in all, I had no real problems with Hilton Boston Downtown. They're friendly, the place is clean, and close to nearby attractions. I can't ask for much more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveljunkies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night while we were visiting friends in Boston. We were given a large, quiet room. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The location was convenient to the shops at restaurants in Quincy Market. The only negative is the area around the hotel is totally dead at night on the weekends (so don't expect to get coffee or a quick snack in the area). Quincy Market was about a 10 min walk. Service was fine; easy check-in and check-out. No problems getting a cab back to the airport, even at 6:30 am on a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Great job!”
Reviews.Author: lifesajourney19
Reviews.Content: despite heavy construction on the building, which completely eliminated any view that I might have had, the hotel staff went above & beyond to ensure I had a satisfactory stay. Beautiful, large room, great powerful shower, great (amazing) quality product selections (shampoo, conditioner etc.). Location is perfect for site seeing around Boston & close to subway station. I will definitely stay there again. Thanks Hilton Downtown Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great location---hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: shawn22306
Reviews.Content: Awesome room and great location. Concierge was very friendly. Front desk made us dinner reservations, even the restaurant bar tender opened a bottle of wine for us that we brought----great over-all experience. Been here several times and never disappoints

Reviews.Title: “Dark room, slow service”
Reviews.Author: BubblesNYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and found the room to be very dark and the service overall very slow (valet never answered the phone, etc.). The lamp shades were ripped. We had an internal room #1033 and it was so dark in the room - not nearly enough lamps. They also had star gazer lilies in the lobby which I am severely allergic to - seems like a less fragrant flower would be a better choice. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms & convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: major1018
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel was great. I was traveling with friends for the weekend and the room we got was quite spacious for the 3 of us. The beds were very comfortable and I really liked the large bathrooms. It was in a great location too, we were within a few minutes walk of Quincy Market/Faneuil Hall, and we were very close to public transportation. Though the hotel was definitely more suited for business travelers, I would definitely consider staying here again. The front desk was very attentive and was willing to do whatever they could to help us find what we need and how to get around. I have to say the only reason I gave this hotel 4 stars was because there was construction going on during the day. I was sick on the day we stayed here and I was trying to sleep in the room, and it was very hard to fall asleep to the sound of construction right outside my window. If you can I would recommend asking for a room away from any construction.

Reviews.Title: “Could use some updating, but location is prime”
Reviews.Author: newyorker88
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton person and try to stay within the Hilton network when I can. This Hilton has a good location, but really could use some updating. Even my upgraded room was just average. The gym was also just OK, and the elevators needs some big time updating - slow and the buttons didn't light up. I'm told they are in the process of fixing them. I've stayed at lots of Hiltons, and this is not my favorite, but it still provides a convenient location and certainly not an uncomfortable stay - although far from great.

Reviews.Title: “Good price good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheRockffc
Reviews.Content: Surprised this isn't top 20 in Boston. Was here on biz and a fine hotel. 4 stars almost for 3 star price. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louise40
Reviews.Content: Instay with Hilton all the time and this hotel is great, clean, comfortable and close to town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lobster rolls”
Reviews.Author: mrapr
Reviews.Content: A good hotel well placed for wandering around historic Boston. The lobster roll in the bar was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: DAKonop
Reviews.Content: I flew into Boston unexpectedly. It was Halloween Weekend 2011 and I was greeted with a rare October snowstorm. I have never stayed overnight in Boston since my parents live 36 miles west where I grew up. But I have now stayed in Hotels on 5 continents so when I say something good about a hotel I hope people listen. I can't say this is a great hotel in comparison to other Hotels in Boston where I have never stayed, but I am still smiling about the person to person service the Hilton provided. From the start of the two nights to finish. The reception desk was most accomidating and service was great. And the LOCATION! I had a wonderful time and I got to visit my parents who were without electricy because of the storm. The return back to the Hotel was welcomed. The stay was well priced though I thought the breakfest was pricey. Overall my business covered the expense without going into my pocket. I am very happy with the Hilton and will stay again if ever required under similar circumstances. Location!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel in the Financial District”
Reviews.Author: HHdreamin
Reviews.Content: For an older hotel, I really enjoy the charm in the rooms. Very nice size, and with a bit of character being in a older building. Everything in the rooms however are current, and clean. Front Desk always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel far better than expected”
Reviews.Author: mac082
Reviews.Content: From the word go the staff were helpful and friendly our room was comfortable with an excellent bed and bathroom.The heating was a mystery! Breakfast was excellent and the team were just great nothing was to much trouble. We were concerned as to how central it would be but need not have worried everything was just a short walk away.Not the most central hotel in Boston but definitely good value and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Better located than expected”
Reviews.Author: Alleyns
Reviews.Content: The comments we had read about room noise on Friday and Saturday nights proved correct, and flying in on a Friday from the UK to be disturbed for 2 nights was offputting, but we were staying in the Financial District and downtowners party so we were prepared for this. The hotel was well set up with restaurant facilities for breakfast and dinner and two lounge areas. We were originally booked to stay for 2 nights but eventually stayed for 4 nights due to hurricane Irene. All the staff are great and were really helpful with the hurricane period and changes to our itinery. Our standard room was comfortable with an adequate en suite. The building may not be new but we found it had character, had been tastefully renovated, and was well maintained. Its location is really good for tourists, close to the waterfront with its numerous boat trips, the New England Aquarium, Boston Tea Party Ship, and Quincy Market. Alternatively walk up to the city centre and join the Freedom Trail, a walk which links all the history of Boston through its buildings linked to the revolutionary past. Be prepared for a 2-3 hour walk however. We took advantage of the hop on and off bus service to get an insight into the city, and found this worked really well. We would definately stay at this hotel if we return to Boston (but not on a Friday or Saturday night).The staff make it a good place to stay and it would certainly rate higher if the party rooms were separated further from tourist accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous pricing”
Reviews.Author: abbeycat25
Reviews.Content: I recently made a reservation for a few days in Boston at the Boston Hilton Financial District. I was quoted (and it was on the website as well) $306 US per night plus taxes, for two of us for two nights. Later in the day I phoned to add a day, and was told that the additional day meant we would have to pay $342 per night, for each of the three nights. We could not now have the $306 rate. Can anyone explain this oddity? Of course, I declined.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you're in Boston for a race”
Reviews.Author: CathyFitz2451
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our first trip to Boston for the Boston Runs to Remember marathon. The hotel suggested for the runners was convenient for the race, but for nothing else. After lots of searching, we found this little gem. It was close enough to the race start and end, but perfect for sightseeing. It's a convenient walk to all the sights, very clean, and a great price. If we return to Boston, we'll return to this Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Soma S
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, convenient to everything. Rates are very reasonable. Service is good too, they do all they can to help. Right behind Quincy Market & Faneuil Hall.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: EvanPSP
Reviews.Content: I'm a very frequent traveler, but not to Boston. I chose the Hilton Financial District because I'm a Hilton Diamond member and the hotel is right across the street from my business appointment. What impressed me first is the friendliness of every single person at the hotel. Excellent service! This hotel is a model for how hotels should engage customers. Great doorman, great front desk, great concierge, great bartender. Room is large, clean, and very comfortable. The hotel obviously has some great history too, but being here for only 20 hours I didn't get to learn a lot about the history. Absolutely a top notch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for visiting all places in Boston”
Reviews.Author: kashyap_111
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel for a week during one of my business trips and found it a convenient place to visit some of best places of Boston during the one-day holiday that I had. The place is calm and peaceful and the staff is well mannered and helpful. The room service is above average. The hotel rooms have false wall partition. SO you can hear whats going in the next room in case if you have ears as sharp as a canine!! The low-point and annoying part is that they do not have flat screen TV. A place like Hilton should definitely have LCD TV. The hotel is very close to Quincy market and Fanheuil Hall and the proximity to State Street station that connects trains is also very good. So the food options are plenty in case you want to try something different than hotel food.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: PatrickLongBeach
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that we have stayed at the Boston Hilton Hotel located in the Financial District and it is fabulous. Although the hotel is not large and grand, it has a very efficient and beautiful lobby with marble floors and beautiful woods on the wall. Built in 1928, the Hotel was Boston's first Art Deco skyscraper. Recently renovated, the rooms are top of the line with dÃ©cor, bedding, robes, etc, but are not large like most other Hilton rooms. However, space in Boston is tight and most of the other hotels are the same way. We also experienced five-star treatment from the staff. The biggest plus of this hotel is the location. You can walk out the door and easily walk anywhere within a few minutes. Like I said in the title, it is location, location, location. There are great bars/pubs and restaurants just a few feet away from the front door. Quincy Marketplace/ Faneuil Hall are about a three minute walk and North Boston (Italian restaurants-we went to Riccardos - amazing food) is about a 10 minute walk. You are just a few minutes from the train stops and the Harbor. If youâ€™re looking for a place to stay while seeing the sights, this is it. One other thing I learned on this trip was how easy it was to take the train to the airport and save the $30 cab ride. As I said, you walk a couple minutes to the train stop (they will direct you), pay $2.00 and the airport is the second train stop. You exit the train and the free shuttle buses are outside. One bus for Terminal A&B and the other for Terminal C&D. The whole process to the terminal took us less than 20 minutes. This is a great City and you cannot miss by staying at this Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: jacqueline q
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Hilton 2 weeks ago and just loved the experience, friendly staff, spotless room and great location, we will be going agin in the new year, a family trip.......

Reviews.Title: “Day and Evening managers spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: Svenskapojke
Reviews.Content: The travel group which handled our luggage from a cruise ship placed our luggage on a bus heading for Canada rather than this hotel. (We learned thsi a week later from a phone call from Canada where our luggage terminated!) The baggage handlers were at fault, but the hotel took responsibility for the lost luggage and did everything humanly possible to find it, i.e. went to 45 plus rooms of fellow travelers inquiring whether the luggage was in their possession and did everything to console us. They even put us in a first class room as consolation. Phoned often to check on us. Such personal courtesy I have never seen in a hotel. Good restaurants within an easy walk. Restaurant in hotel also with bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - unexpected missing "bar"”
Reviews.Author: sevimcan11
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is located in the heart of the Boston finacial district. The rooms are nice and clean - as expected by Hilton. We were very shocked to find an empty bar in the room - not even water bottles? Never experienced that. We were asked to buy water from the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hwy363
Reviews.Content: Hilton Boston Downtown is in a great location - very walkable to all the things people go to Boston to see (5 mins to Quincy Market/Faneuil Hall; 15 to Boston Common, School Street, North End). Very close to two T stations (State and Aquarium). Also a good assortment of restaurants/pubs close by, although some do close early on weeknights. We found there was a lot of street (and hotel) noise on weekend nights, especially when the bars let out, but otherwise our stay was fairly peaceful. The hotel itself is typical Hilton, perhaps a bit bland in this case. Comfortable enough, but I'm not quite sure how it rated four AAA diamonds. The staff were all very friendly. Cleaning wasn't quite up to standard though, with a few things overlooked each day (towels, toilet paper resupply, sink cleaning, etc.). I'd definitely stay again though, especially with the decent weekend rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: CowboysFan123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the most affordable and the most conveniently located in the downtown area - just blocks from Fanueil Hall, Quincy Market, the Wharf/Aquarium, the North End, the Freedom Trail, and lots of fabulous shopping and restaurants. We contacted the hotel before arrival and asked for early check in and co-location of our room with friends that we were meeting there for the weekend. We arrived early and found that both of our requests were accomodated and that our rooms were very comfortable and nicely appointed. During our visit we spent some time in the hotel bar/lounge and found it to be a friendly, comfortable atmosphere for watching sports and visiting with our friends. Without a doubt, the best feature of this hotel is the fantastic staff of concierges who know their city, listen to the desires of their customers, and never fail to deliver the BEST advice about where to go, what to do, and how to make it the best possible experience. We will definitely stay here again the next time we are in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “great location and room for the kids”
Reviews.Author: jmel76
Reviews.Content: we went to boston to visit the childrens museum and the aquarium. this hotel (although a little pricey) was right in the heart of everything. we walked to the childrens museum, the aquarium, and faneuil hall. i would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: DNA513
Reviews.Content: This property is 2 1/2 blocks from Quincy Market and 2 blocks from nearest T station. so for enjoying Boston this is a very good choice. All parking is valet, you can self park 1 1/2 block down the road, but you will only save a few dollars. Easy to fine and like everywhere in boston within on block you have over 12 bar/eateries. Not to mention you are a stone's throw away from Quincy Market. Rooms are very large, and modern. I have stayed here twice once with my family and once as a couple. They have sweet rooms that work well with a family of four. Small workout facilities but convenient. Staff is very friendly and willing to help. Can't go wrong with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: Brittany1225
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal on a room here in July. Two friends and I drove up from Jersey on a whim for an over-nighter. We spent a reasonable price, and the room served it's purpose - we had an air conditioned place to sleep in comfortable beds. What really impressed me was the staff. Maybe I'm just not used to the whole valet/bellhop/city hotel process, but I thought the staff was very helpful and friendly. If I return to Boston (which I plan to sometime soon), I'd definitely consider staying here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the hefty price tag”
Reviews.Author: neimanmarxist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September of 2011 for a labor day weekend in Boston. We got suites at the senior rate (my mom's the senior- not me), which is somewhat lower than the best available, but was still pretty expensive. The suite was very nice, though the lobby is underwhelming. Flat screens, big rooms, huge lovely bed, nice bathroom with fancy bath amenities. My main gripe about this place was that 1) they don't get to your room to clean it until like 5 pm, 2) service in the restaurant downstairs is really bad, it took us an hour to get a drink , 3) the worst part was that our rooms had scaffolding and paneling up and we could not see out the windows. What the....? You should not be charging a few hundred buckaroos to put people in a box! Hello! We could not see ANYTHING except the sheet of wall that contains the scaffolding. THey should be selling these rooms at a lower rate not putting people who paid a premium in them. Goodness. I complained and they were all like, "nothing we can do about it, hotel is sold out." As consolation, they also said, "the view isn't that good." Seriously? They should notify people beforehand. So I gave the room quality a "poor" rating because seriously, for that price, you should be able to see out your dang window.

Reviews.Title: “Over one year later and time's are a changin'”
Reviews.Author: Chase71
Reviews.Content: Change can be good or bad and in the case of the Hilton Financial District I'll start with the good: 30 inch Flat screens in both rooms! Finally! But that's really the good news. Now the negative: Hilton Financial District had a management change. They were bought by a new holding company and they've made some substantial changes with some services and staffing. 1. The wonderful hot breakfast buffet is no more. Good bye to smoked salmon and eggs Benedict. Apparently the breakfast coupons are now at two tiers. Continental, and for the higher paying room rates, a hot breakfast that's only cook to order. And the two breakfast coupon tiers are regardless of Hilton elite level. Sorry Diamond members. Weekends do get a couple of hot items like scrambled eggs and bacon but otherwise being waited on for a self serve danish, yogurt, or banana just isn't worth it compared to a $2.00 7-11 breakfast biscuit you can pick up instead. Sad news indeed. In a nut shell the restaurant is being divorced from the hotel. Apparently for cost savings benefits the hotel wants to cut ties from the restaurant and lease the operation instead. The executive chef was let go and many other positions in the hotel as well. 2. Lodgnet. Like your cable TV? Like many other chains, this Hilton has gone to a private network that runs their own repeating commercials to offset their TV service costs. If you stay a couple of nights you probably won't care. But if you are the longer stay business traveler and you like to leave the TV on you'll get the same repeated 5-10 commercials that over time get to be annoyingly repetitive. OK that's the good and the bad changes but there is still good news: For the most part from a guest's standpoint most the staff members that have made this hotel great are still around despite the management changes. The front desk manager Sandip Bojani, the breakfast waiter Dan, the name evening bartenders and valet attendants I have gotten to know over the years are still around. These people are truly what makes this hotel a pleasure to visit. In conclusion HFD is still an excellent choice for a inner city Boston stay, Just some of the perks that made it outstanding have been cut.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: kerwriter
Reviews.Content: About $300 a night for a good sized suite. Good value as our adult daughter was able to sleep on hideabed (not comfortably tho) and we did not have to get another room. Pros: Great central location to access the Freedom Trail and most of the historical sites in the city. If you are a walker you can get just about anywhere you'd like without a cab. Upgraded to corner suite, two large rooms, separate very effective thermostats, each with a large screen tv. Nice bathroom with tub/shower. Excellent water pressure and heat. Comfortable king bed in bedroom. Refrigerator in room Nice individual coffee makers in room. Ask for extra pods. Windows open, and this is huge for me. Staff was friendly and helpful. Decent fitness room. Our room was quiet. The maids did a good job. Cons: A bit shabby. Our room was in great need of new carpeting. Executive floor or suite has little meaning. No snacks, wine or coffee room (as in other Hilton Executive floors I've been on). The restaurant was beautiful physically but as usual Hilton fails to take advantage of the setting. We had a nice Steak Frits but the menu was limited and unimaginative. Honestly, Hilton could make this a destination for locals and visitors alike, and a go to cocktail hour, if they would play on the 1930's decor and hire a creative chef to update dishes of the period. Oh well. The hideabed made for a very uncomfortable sleep. Our daughter ended up folding it back up and just sleeping on it as a couch. No guide to the hotel services in the room, which was strange.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location of a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: krummi
Reviews.Content: Spent a few nights here, with a small group of people, earlier this month. This was my 7th or 8th trip to Boston and I've stayed in various locations, Financial District/Quincy Market, Back Bay and airport hotels. This one did not disappoint! We had a lovely and spacious room on the 11th floor with a view of the Customs house clock tower. My travel companions were on the 8th and 4th floor and all had similar rooms size wise, except for the 4th floor room which was smaller. The room was neat and well cleaned, plenty of amenities in the bathroom, and the empty fridge provided was convinient. No mini bar though, which didn't matter to us. The beds and pillows were very comfy. If I had to complain about something it would be that some more shelf space and hangers in the bathroom would have been nice (there is space enough). If you are a very light sleaper you might be disturbed by the street noices, but for me the view made up for that - I'm sure that had our room faced in a different direction there would have been less noice (not that it was that much at all!). The staff was all very friendly and accommodating. We sat down in the restaurant twice, for a light dinner and for drinks, and found it quite nice. One of my favourite restaurants in Boston, Umbria Prime, is just around the corner, as are plenty of other restaurants in the Quincy market area. At the end of the street, around the corner (towards Atlantic avenue) is a breakfast place which I can't remember the name of....Good coffee, smoothies, bagles and all sorts of pastries to take or eat in. Didn't try the hotel breakfast. The location is excellent for a stroll through Quincy Market, the harbor side (and Aquarium) and for the shops on Washington Street. I always describe Boston to those who haven't been that most places are within walking distance. Boston Common and Beacon Hill are only 10-15 min and if you want to go over to Newbury Street or Prudential Center you only need to add about 5 mins to that. As long as the weather is fine and you are not in too much of a hurry I strontly recommend going on foot, and if not there is always a taxi close by (if you don't fancy the subway, which I have to admit is not as easily comprehendible as f.ex. the metro in Paris). Overall very happy with my stay here and may well stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Night on the town”
Reviews.Author: umass123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great time spending a great time spending a recent weekend night on the town. We arrived around 11am and parked at the post office square garage which is two blocks away and is $9 dollars a day on the weekends (which you can't beat in the area). We walked over to the Fort Point area which was holding an open arts studio (several old warehouse buildings were converted to studios for artists to ply their trade and they come together and hold an open house several times a year). After this, we had an easy time checking into our room. We had a standard room which was very comfortable and had plenty of space. The hotel is in an excellent location within easy walking distance to Faneuil Hall, the North End and the Seaport area (which is a new happening area with many new high end restaurants). It also was one of the more affordable hotels in the area. There is a restaurant and bar located in the lobby that is okay, but I would recommend venturing out as there are many other choices within a two or three block radius of the hotel. Whether your looking for casual or fine dining, seafood or steak, or anything in between for that matter, it is all nearby. There's also a neat little Irish Pub right next door (Dooley's Tavern) with live Irish music. The only compliant is that we were on a lower floor and had no view, however, I don't believe higher floors would have much of a view either as the hotel is packed in amongst many other tall buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and very enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy M
Reviews.Content: Absolutely brilliant stay at this hotel. Was ushered into the hotel by the doorman under a big umbrella while they sorted the luggage....nice in the pouring rain! Room was enormous and very well decorated. Lovely furnture and added touches like bathrobe and lavazza coffee machine in the room! Bar are was pleasant and quite reasonable prices. Location was ideal for exploring Boston - very close to all the waterfront attractions and the downtown area - only downside was the lack of a tube close to the hotel - had to walk to Long Wharf or State Street (10 mins). Staff excellent and concierge was highly knowledgable and recommended some fantastic, if pricey(!), places to eat! Will definately return next time I am in New England

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Perrault29
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 403 and found it to be very small and poorly decorated. They had turned off the air conditionning and for some reason it was very hot in there. When we inquired about this we were told that all rooms in all hotels in Boston were in the same condition!! We come to Boston every year and so far this is the most dispointing hotel we have stayed in as far as price quality is concerned. On the positive side, the location is good and the doorman and concierge were friendly. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcpatti
Reviews.Content: Rooms here are quite large by Boston standards (or really any large city in the Northeast/MidAtlantic corridor) and the floor plan sets the bed back quite a ways from the door, meaning very little hallway noise bleeds into the room. A major plus. Bed comfortable but not outstanding. Room decor is very muted, almost bland, kind of like they're going for the Colonial feel but took it a little too far. Room was nice, fresh and clean. The breakfast buffet is underwhelming especially at that price, but surprisingly the hotel bar is one of the best bargains in Boston, with $6 pints of microbrews. The bar closes a bit early (11pm if I remember correctly, on a weekend) but you can carry your drinks to the "library" across the hall and relax there. The room price is high but in line with other Boston hotels of the same caliber. It's a very expensive city. I would stay here again though!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: llfoster
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for an evening. As previously discussed, the location is convenient for a variety of activities - so that was a plus. We did receive a room upgrade without requesting one - greatly appreciated. The staff - from front desk to concierge to parking valet - was pleasant. A minor drawback - there is no executive lounge for HH upper level members. Additionally, we found the room(s) to need updating. We did have a suite but found it to be rather drab - from the wall color (rusty/sandy/brownish) to the fact that the walls were essentially bare- the furniture was very bland too - looked like soemthing you would expect to see in a middle school. We did have flat screen TV's - one in each room. The rooms were spacious.

Reviews.Title: “HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: barry m
Reviews.Content: OK so the view out of the window was of scaffolding but who cares when the room is quiet and comfortable and the hotel is bang in the centre of town with only a moment or two to walk to Faneuil Hall and all the other attractions. So much better location than the waterfront that we stayed in later on our trip. The breakfast here at the Hilton was the best hotel breakfast we had on the whole vacation. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MattLusk
Reviews.Content: Very good location for site seeing and doing the tourist thing. The hotel is just a few blocks from anything you might want to do in downtown Boston. I few blocks from the Trolly Tours, Freedom Trail and restaurants. Very courteous staff and overall great experience. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: CTtraveler53
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two weekends ago. Hotel is covered with scaffolding so, at the moment, not very inviting. There was nothing on the web site indicating that this was the case and that any room facing the street on one side of the hotel would have the scaffolding as the view. Room was small, standard Hilton. Could not understand why there was only one bathrobe available in a room with a king-sized bed. Restaurant had decent, but overpriced breakfast. The wait staff was very friendly, desk staff helpful when we reported something broken in the room (actually two things were broken. They were repaired quickly.) While the hotel was a short distance from most major attractions, the area was fairly dead at night. On the positive side, it was quiet and there was not a lot of street noise. Hotels in Boston are very expensive (surprisingly so) so we chose this hotel because of a favorable rate, but we would not choose to this property again, because it felt flat and a little worn out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very close to Quincy Market”
Reviews.Author: newy0rkcitygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend just to see the sights of the city and we chose this hotel because of it's close proximity to Quincy Market. It's literally only a 5 minute walk, and then you have access to the restaurants and shops. The financial district is very quiet at night, but we didn't mind because we were only there to sleep. If you're looking for nightlife, it's just the 5 minute walk towards the Market. We would definitely stay there again, make sure to check out the North End, which is the Italian historic area. There are TONS of authentic Italian restaurants and shops; also recommend walking the Freedom Trail. My only complaint with the hotel is that there was scaffolding covering both of our windows, we didn't mind because we were just in the hotel to sleep/get ready for the day. But if you do not want this, I would call ahead and request a room that is not near the scaffolding.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dhyland
Reviews.Content: Standard rooms, good location. Renovations were underway while I was there for 2 nights. Hotel comp'ed room rate by $ 100 per night due to extremely loud drilling, etc.

Reviews.Title: “It's not luxury but it's excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Neil C
Reviews.Content: Having read several less than complimentary reviews I was a bit worried wondering just what we'd booked up for. So I'm happy to say that we couldn't have been more satisfied with our stay. From arrival to departure the staff couldn't have been more helpful. The Hotel is clean and quiet and the room we had was huge with two double beds and a large bathroom. It is well sited for all the Boston attractions and is surrounded by plenty of good eating an drinking establishments. You are five minutes from the Trolleys, the Ducks, the Whale boats, Quincy Market, the aquarium etc. etc. Do I have any complaints...? - well no, but if pushed I'd have to ask "who charges for internet access these days...?" $14.95 for 24 hours is a bit steep............. In summary - this will be my first choice on future visits to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at it's best”
Reviews.Author: TravelTime619
Reviews.Content: Hilton's always do a nice job for the business traveler, but this time I was here with my family. Unfortunately, my stepbrother broke his foot the day before we came. The concierge let he and his fiance check in at 9 so he could rest away from the lobby. The beds are so comfy here and the rooms have everything you'd need. Clean, bright and new. The bathrooms have Peter Thomas Roth products and ample room to get ready. The bar is overpriced in a city known for its pubs...take it outside for the night. We did enjoy some wine here as a nightcap, but my step mom's drink was $22 for a white Russian. A bit steep if you ask me. Nice location near the water and very close (a few blocks) to the Quincy Market, a brisk walk to Paul Revere's house and Little Italy for a change of pace. $15 cab ride to Fenway.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA
Reviews.Title: “Good location, but that was it.”
Reviews.Author: bgjolie
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with the location of this hotel in the Financial District, however, the hotel simply wasn't up to the Hilton standard and our stay was very disappointing. The room was small and there was no view (we faced other rooms as was the case with many others). The bathroom was not cleaned properly (housekeeping seemed to forget to clean the floor on a daily basis). The worst part of the room was the bed. It was lop-sided and gave us morning back aches. This is the first time I've experienced this in a Hilton hotel. To make matters worse, they placed us in a room next to 4 elevators. So we heard dinging elevators doors all night long and early in the morning. I prefer Hilton hotels for the sleep quality, and it certainly didn't exist here. Finally the air conditioning did not work well and the room was stuffy. With so many hotels in the Financial District, there are better options. We will not return to this hotel and don't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Weekend! Would do it again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: forestluv9
Reviews.Content: My friend and our daughters took some time over February break to go to Boston. We found a package thru the Aquarium and booked at the Hilton. It was right in the middle of everything. The kids got backpacks from the front desk filled with goodies, we got a complementary upgrade on our room, and the package included an in-room movie with roomservice delivering popcorn and soda. The package also came with 4 tickets to the Aquarium and 4 tickets to the Children's museum. The kids were amazed, my friend was blown away by the quality of the Hilton, and I was really really happy with the entire weekend. We can't wait till next February!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hilton hotel”
Reviews.Author: pmny
Reviews.Content: I stay here most of the time when visting Boston. It is in a great location downtown ideal for business and for fun after work. Not far from the North End. Rooms are clean and nicely furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, some noise issues - would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: S L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything we expected - clean, great location, comfortable, guests felt pampered. There is a small gym available. They were doing some repairs inside the hotel, so there was some hammering and drilling from 9 am until 5 pm - reasonable time, yet still somewhat stressful, as we arrived in the afternoon exhausted and wanted to nap, which was difficult because of the noise. The staff was very friendly - despite some mishaps when they double charged us at the end of the stay - though I suppose everyone makes mistakes from time to time. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel1234512
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I came to Boston to see a Red Sox game and I chose this hotel as it was close the the harbor area and downtownl I was not in the least bit disappointed. We took a water taxi from the airport and were dropped off at the harbor. We decided the hotel was close enough so we walked instead of taking a taxi. They were VERY welcoming and helpful. I had three or four people ask us if they could help us in any way, including the doorman. The room was clean and very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel. There are a few good restaurants (Irish pubs) close by as well for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. We did have the breakfast buffet at the hotel one morning and it was pretty good. Within walking distance to many things including Faneuil Hall Marketplace.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: DudeWolsey
Reviews.Content: The first hotel of four that I stayed in during my ten-day visit of the USA east coast. The reception was welcoming - even at 11.20pm - and the room was comfortable. The only serious matter which tarnished my two-night stay was the noise of the air conditioning units on the roof of what I think was the single-storey lobby outside the window. So loud were the fans and motors that it took ages to get to sleep. Had I been staying longer, I would have insisted on a room in a different part of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel -”
Reviews.Author: Robbbyva
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in early August and it was fine. I did think the rates were high and they did place me in a room where the shower was quite bizarre. The shower head instead of being on either end of the tub was literally in the middle of tub. Just kinda weird. They also did not have any flat screen TVs. With that said, I did have friends who were staying at the hotel after I did and the Hotel were replacing their TVs. I would rate the restaurant a B, the prices high even for a city and the service was just average. With that said, who goes to Boston to eat in a hotel ( I usually eat in the Hotel Restaurant on my day of arrival - to tired to do anything else). I would not mind staying at this Hotel if I need to.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and unique”
Reviews.Author: Salsadancer146
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Close by to many excellent restaurants and it's within a 5 minute walk of Quincy market. Staff and concierge we're extremely helpful with directions, bags, etc... The room was unique in design that separated the bathroom from the bedroom, made it feel spacious and private. Everything was very clean and done tastefully. The view was quite poor at the time due to scaffolding and work outside, but the room and location were worth the poor view.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pascale
Reviews.Content: I booked througt Priceline for 125$. The room was very clean, room 415, no bedbugs, nice linen, and the bed was perfect. We had a LCD TV, no view but it was not an issue. The location is very good, near everything Try the lobster roll at Neptune Oysters. Went to the bar Goody Glovers and try the Scallion mashed potato, cheddar and crispy bacon spring rolls with a chive sour cream, very good with a beer in the middle in the afternoon ;-) Great time in Boston !!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION FOR ALL ATTRACTIONS NEAR THE HARBOR”
Reviews.Author: BARB9876
Reviews.Content: Waiking distance to harbor area & all attractions used subway from airport to hotel excelexcellent Irish Pub outside front door for breakfast on Sunday. Staff were very, very helpful when whenever we neede questions answered. Quiet for sleeping. We were there on the weekend therefore not busy. Clean, smaller rooms, building built in 1921 as first art deco skyscraper unique .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, but misc. charges too much.”
Reviews.Author: 440Washington
Reviews.Content: We booked through hotwire and got a good rate for dowtown Boston, but by the time you add in parking, tips and internet fee just another expensive hotel. In this day and age with smart phones, why charge for pc internet use?? We choose to use our phone and not incur this extra charge. The room was nice, large and well appointed. We picked up some cannoli"s from Mikes Pastry to take home the next day, but was disappointed that the mini-bar cooler was not really a fridge. The front desk did take them for us and refridgerate them..at no extra cost! I would stay a again if the rate was good. Also, I want to say Hilton's misc. charges are no more or less than anyone else downtown

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PKOR
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a suite in this ideally located hotel, nearby Quincy market. For a family (4) it is a reasonnable choice which allows you to have separate rooms for the kids. The hotel is a bit old, but the staff is very friendly, the rooms are quiet and clean. The only surprising thing would be the old fashioned tv sets in the rooms, really not 21st century models!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - not best choice for families”
Reviews.Author: cleveland6
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was fantastic! We were able to walk everywhere. Eddie the bellboy was extremely friendly and helpful. We stayed five nights the end of July - beginning of August. Valet parking is not well organized. We had to wait each time we arrived at the hotel just to give the attendent our key, even though the second time we were the only ones there. Getting our car out was much easier, always there when they said it would be ready but still had to find the attendent so we could get key from him. When we first arrived at the hotel our room was not quite ready, even though it was after the standard 3pm check in time. We only had to wait about 20 minutes, which wasn't bad. We had reserved a bedroom suite for 2 adults and 4 children. Because of the wait, staff offered us free use of a rollaway bed, which was very helpful. Concierge was helpful, although when I asked if she could print some tickets for me, she said she could - she ordered them for me and printed them for the Duckboat tours. However, she neglected to tell me about the $12 service charge for ordering online (not her fault, the charge was from the Duckboat - but it was only a 4 minute walk; we could have saved the $12 just by walking to where the tour started and purchasing our tickets there. - Live and Learn, I guess.) Suite was adequate, plenty of space. Pretty clean. Minor inconveniences - never had bath towels for 6 people except for the first night because I requested them before we came but reallly, if you are reserving a room for 6 people, 6 towels should be a given. Also, ran out of toilet paper more than once. (This is always a problem with 6 people so believe it or not, we always pack some in our suitcase. Just didn't expect it to happen at a Hilton!) Also, was told we had a mini fridge so I brought along pop & juice boxes, string cheese, fruit for the kids. Actually, there is no fridge so, just any empty mini bar which keeps things cool, not cold and was extremely small. We had to use a cooler for the 5 days we were there. Our room was very close to the ice machine, but it was still an inconvenience to empty the water and refill with ice for 5 days. I don't want this to sound like we were completely unhappy. We weren't. The room was pricey, plus valet parking, + $50 in misc. taxes. Basically, our room cost us $400/night - with NO free breakfast, NO free internet, and no pool for the kids (which we did know in advance). There were only a handful of television channels, which is ok for adults, but very hard with children. The Hilton does offer the Nickelodeon channel, but in the evening it becomes Nick at Night. I do NOT let my children watch George Lopez, so they were stuck with Sports Center. Without children I would have given this Hilton a rating of 4 (5 if it was just based on location) but I was very disappointed in this hotel for familes. As other reviewers have stated, the beds are phenomenal. The tvs are old & the reception is fuzzy. The sleeper sofa has seen better days. Not comfortable to sleep on and cushions were fraying quite a bit. Front desk staff was pleasant, although a bit stuffy. Concierge was very friendly and helpful. Eddie the bellboy was fantastic. Valet parking staff, ok. Overall, I would stay here again if the price were right (with free internet) and without children. If I were to bring my family again, I would look into some of the other hotels in the Financial District. I HIGHLY recommend staying in the Financial District even though it is a bit pricier. No ned for a car in Boston, we only used ours to drive to Provincetown for a day. Again, overall nice hotel, there are just better options for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Solid Location of Boston”
Reviews.Author: jahgalva
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed in Boston at the Boston Financial Hotel. We have stayed here often after previously staying at several other hotels in Boston. However, once we stayed here, we have never hesitated to return (unlike the previous Boston hotels). The location is superb - only a couple of blocks from Fanueil Hall, North End and Boston Harbor. Our value is always outstanding, and the staff has remained consistent thru the past few years - all outstanding, friendly, and a knack for remembering faces. Great spot to base your Boston visit.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, Reliable, Conveniently Located in Downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: FourDayTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Boston Downtown--Financial District is a solid business or tourist hotel in the heart of downtown Boston. You will be steps to the North End, the Financial District and a short walk to the T or major tourist attractions such as Quincy Market and the New England Aquarium. We had an enormous room that was clean; it seems this hotel may be up for a renovation or may have been converted from a previous owner or use. For example, our room had a tube TV instead of a flat screen--not a big deal, but noticeable in 2011. A few other odd details--a missing lock on the bathroom door, the handle in the tub not flush with the wall--are not up to the typical standard one is used to with Hilton. None of these details negatively impacted our stay. The prices are reasonable in an expensive city and the location is convenient--unless you are driving; this area is a very expensive place to park. Staff is friendly and professional, cabs are plentiful and it's a great city to explore by foot. If you have a meeting in the Financial District, this is a comfortable spot with solid, efficient service.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: gigidev
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here this week and had a normal wonderful hilton experience. On my last morning, I went in search of a Diet Coke to take to my meeting which was off site. The gift shop (unbelievably!) out of diet coke. I ran into the sales manager and another hotel exec as I was leaving and they asked how my stay was. I said great except.... there was NO diet coke. The woman said, "just a minute," and walked away to quickly return with a diet coke from her own personal stash. Wonderful Hilton service!!!!! Thank you. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: upsnam
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location near the waterfront and quincy market. Rooms are small and ours had an interior v iew of nothing!! ( other side of the hotel and fans down below) When asked if there were any exterior rooms, I was rudely told this was all they had. I was part of a wedding group staying there and had booked several months in advance. Parking is overpriced at $38 per night, valet only. It also takes at least 30 minutes to get your car and if you're lucky, it might even be yours. I wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: triggeruk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend whilst working just outside of the city. Located in a great place and close to the Acquarium and surrounding facilities. Went on a whale watching trip from there - and eating around that area was nice. It was very quiet at the weekend - although only 5-10 mins to lots of places with plenty happening. Its less than 10 mins to the shops on Washington St and just another block or two to the Common. Hotel itself was comfortable and what you'd expect from a big chain. I had some views out from the room, but spent so little time in there that it didn't matter. Breakfast was a bit disappointing and didn't bother on the 2nd night - I wouldn't bother paying for it as really wasn't a lot of choice and much better places in walking distance

Reviews.Title: “we would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kladuke
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay and had a great location. We were within short walking distance from many different attractions. The doorman was very welcoming and helpful with directions when we first arrived and the concierge was also very helpful and polite. Our room was very nice and the bed was amazing. The bathroom was very spacious. When we go back we will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to see Boston”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker06
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Financial District for 5 nights at the beginning of July and over Independence weekend. The Hotel is located just in the right place to explore Boston, 5 minutes walk from Long Wharf, Quincy market and the hub of activity around the harbour and just over 10 minutes from Boston Common in the other direction. It is also 5 to 10 mins to get to a T station depending upon which line you want. Downtown crossing saves you changing and takes about 10 mins, but the local station is just 5 mins away. You can walk to Prudential Centre and Copley and this is about 15 to 20 min stroll, manageable, depending on the weather! The hotel itself is in the financial district so at the weekend the local streets are like an empty morgue, which is great from a no noise perspective. The side of the hotel we stayed on had no bars or restaurants so it was really quiet. Other reviews have mentioned the area as noisy, but we heard absolutely nothing, whether this was due to which side you are on I am not sure, but there was no street or traffic noise and we were on one of the lowest floor (4th). Great lifts, lots of them and super fast, never had to wait for than a few seconds for a lift and 1st to 4th floor took a blink of an eye. Staff were friendly and welcoming and check in was swift. Checkout was also instant as the bill was spot on. Door staff always offered to help and also werenâ€™t on the constant look out for tips as I have found in the past (esp. in USA), they seemed they just wanted to do a good job. Our rooms (we had 2) were huge corner rooms and were great. The old tv was a bit dated and the reception patchy on some channels, but this in a minor point, I am sure they will upgrade them sometime soon. As it was a big room a big television isnâ€™t a problem. Not sure if it was due to being a Diamond Hhonors member or standard for the room, but the bathroom amenities were excellent and well worth using, unlike some of the dreadful concoctions you get in some hotels. Maid service was a bit hit and miss, for 3 of the 5 days and on arrival it was brilliant, 2 days it came very late (4.30 to 5.30 in the afternoon) and after a day out you just want to relax not move around a cleaner and whether is was due to us being there it wasnâ€™t a full job, no topping up of the tea and coffee, no face cloths left etc. We did ring down re the face cloths to get some, they apologised and said some would be sent up to the room, they never did arrive, so we gave up. Breakfast (continental) was included and was fairly good range of cereal, fruit, yogurt and bagels/ toast etc. Strangely on weekends (and 4th July) all guests also had access to hot food such a sausages, eggs and bacon for free, but on weekdays they moved the dishes to a different room and charged? All a bit odd, even Holiday Inn Express gives a hot breakfast for free now, seemed a bit penny pinching to charge $5 on weekdays and nothing at the weekend. On the note of strange things, the waiting staff in the restaurant were dressed really oddly. Everyone wore jeans, not smart neat ones but baggy, scruffy looking ones, just didnâ€™t look right. It must have been sanctioned / planned as everyday, all the waiters wore them. It made no difference to the service which was fine, it just didnâ€™t look right to see waiters in scruffy denim jeans in a 4 / 5 star hotel. Didnâ€™t try room service, but menu looked reasonable, surcharges were excessive though, with service (18%) and tray charge ($5) added by default. Overall, a great location, not cheap but good value, big rooms, nice staff. On the negative, maid service a bit unpredictable, requests not always fulfilled and scruffy waiters (minor down points really on what is a good hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Keep coming back to this fine Hotel, can't get enough of it...”
Reviews.Author: bubba6240
Reviews.Content: Make sure to stay the Weekend. Everyone is pleasant and easy to talk to if you have any questions or problems. Great location to anywhere you want to go. Very friendly and helpful. We go back every year and stay the weekend. It's always a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Be Better”
Reviews.Author: goodie411
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about the staff at this hotel. From the moment we arrived, they took such good care of us. We arrived Saturday night on the July 4th holiday weekend. Just as we pulled up to the valet, our car started to overheat. Immediately the valets offered to help us with the car and figure out the issue. As they helped us unload our luggage, they told us they would let the car sit before trying to move it (we decided it was too late to AAA and deal with the car that night). We headed to the front desk to check in and were in our room in less than five minutes. A little while later, we got a call from the valet who wanted us to take a look at the car before they moved it just to be sure wouldn't cause any additional damage. In the meantime we ordered room service. For $19.50 you get bread, a salad and steak and fries. We all agreed that the steak was some of the best we'd ever had! In the morning, the valets stayed with my mother as she waited for the AAA tow truck to show up. We had no issue extending our check out time to deal with the car. We ate breakfast in the restaurant downstairs and the staff was very friendly and prompt. The buffet was a bit pricey ($22/pp). After discovering that we needed to spend another night in town (not our original plan), we were given an even bigger room at the same rate as the previous, all without me even asking. From the valet to the front desk to room service to the cleaning staff to the waiters, every member of the staff we encountered was more than friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: fava02
Reviews.Content: A trip to Boston has become an annual event. The downtown Hilton is our favorite place to stay; great service, very clean, and a wonderful location! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms nicely renovated”
Reviews.Author: spcfa
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised after my stay here this week. Room was very freshly renovated, bed/sheets were wonderful with excellent light for reading. Absolutely quiet for sleeping. All excellent amenities, and I was able to stay here for a decent rate ($200). Even the coffee maker in the room produced a solid cuppa. Hotel staff was helpful and cheery and pleasant. Nothing negative to report whatsoever. I came in to town on the train - it took me 15 minutes to walk from South Station to the hotel, with my luggage and in heels, so the location was superb.

Reviews.Title: “definitely a mixed bag. Great location, tiny rooms, over priced, uneven service”
Reviews.Author: Nepean01
Reviews.Content: the location is really hard to beat BUT...the room was only slightly larger than the one king bed, check in was a zoo and they tried to charge me 60 dollars for two days worth of wireless internet access

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay! Fantastic Concierge service!”
Reviews.Author: NewNews
Reviews.Content: Visited Boston for the weekend with another couple and had a ball! The concierge service was impeccable! He had wonderful suggestions for everything from sight seeing to dining options - and they were all spot on! Rooms were clean and well appointed, though I did find it unusual to have an old tube television rather than a flat screen. The bed and linens were fantastic, we both slept great! The room was a little on the small side, but with so much to do in Boston, who hangs out in their hotel room?! Overall a fantastic trip and an excellent hotel. Would recommend to anyone looking for a centrally located, chic, clean, modern place to stay with great amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Sudisha
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located very near to most of the attracions- quincy mkt ,macys,south station ......everything is walking distance. The Concierge was very helful..........had nice one page map of the city....... The interiors are beautiful............the outside of building is being renovated

Reviews.Title: “Great location to harbor and bars/dining.”
Reviews.Author: originalXfactor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a friend's wedding at the harbor. Hotel was the older, nostalgic styling, reminiscent of what I would expect from the 'elegant' hotel era. Rooms were older, but nicely appointed and updated. Elevators fast for a tall building. Valet was a little slow for my taste, especially at $42 a night. Kudos to front desk and housekeeping staff for getting us in to our room early so we could freshen up before the wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Playa1971
Reviews.Content: Very big room we were 2 couples 2 beds. Staff help to find the best place to visit, restaurant ... & even a map. Hotel was Built in 1928, last september It was under renovation. They did everything to keep it as is. Great location in the old Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and very good staff.”
Reviews.Author: RNewmie
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and eager to help in anyway with directions and dining suggestions. Our room was very clean. The location is a short walk from the market and minutes from city transportation. I would give ten stars for this hotel on staff alone. We were very pleased with or stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but rooms dark”
Reviews.Author: baysidegirl55
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently and the position is great. Very easy walk to all the tourist sights and a little coffee place on the other side of the road on the corner. Staff were very friendly and helpful and went out of their way to help. Breakfast was good with a good selection of fresh fruit, cereals, eggs, toast, pastries etc. As it is in the business district it is quiet at night which is great for sleeping. My only negative is the rooms are really dark. A lot face into a courtyard type of thing and there is no sun or light, pretty depressing really. Had the lights on all the time. Other than that the room and bathroom was clean and although not huge the rooms are a reasonable size. Paying for internet access irks me in this day and age but that's a Hilton chain thing. Not their fault.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed there once”
Reviews.Author: alena70
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night, and experience was ok. We had a bedroom suit, it was huge, and it got everything, but still, on my taste, not new enough, for that price. The restaurant is terrible, probably we came not in good time, but the stuff wasn't friendly, service was slow and finally the served me a bad seafood, and didn't even apologize.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreGuest123
Reviews.Content: Rooms and location are good, with the exception of the very old TV's. However, when I checked in the service was truly awful. I arrived around 11 PM and there was nobody at the front desk. After waiting a couple of minutes somebody emerged and started to check me in. No smile, no apology. He took an unusually long time to check me in. To compound matters, the phone rang, and he answered it and talked for a minute or 2! I stood there pretty dumbfounded. And when he hung up, no apology. He then informed me that I had a package at the hotel. When I asked him if he could please get it for me, he said no - because he couldn't leave the desk! When I asked him why he was somehow able to leave when I had arrived at the hotel, he glared. A couple of minutes later someone else came and mercifully got my package for me. I don't mean to exaggerate - the whole thing took less than 10 minutes from arrival until I was on the way to my room. And in fairness, I was very tired that night and that probably accentuated the service or lack thereof. But as a frequent Hilton guest and a very tired traveler that night I found the service incredibly poor. Amazingly, I wrote this to the hotel's general manager, and did not get a response.

Reviews.Title: “young kids exposed to bad language all night”
Reviews.Author: hitcher47
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times in the past for Business and with my family. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are very nice and the suites are spacious. My last stay was for a few nights last spring with my family during marine week, There was a marching band staying at the hotel and ufortunatly the whole floor sounded like a frat party most of the night.
