There was very vulgar language coming from the room next door that it was very loud till three AM including music, glass breaking and fighting (sounded more like messing around between friends then anything serious but it was loud), We were up most of the night with the tv volume up in my room so my three year old son and ten year old daughter would near hear what was going on (it did not work). I understand these things happen but my issue is with the staff who I called all night. They told me they were sorry and this party would not be invited back again but they apparently could not do any thing to stop it. They may have called the room next door but it it did not do any good as my kids were exposed to loud bad language most of the night. When I was complained again in the morning they added hilton points to my account and apoligized. Extremly dissapointing for a hilton. I don't think I will be going back,

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for location near Fanuil Hall”
Reviews.Author: billanddoyle
Reviews.Content: Weekend rates are better because it is in the Financial Dist where most restaurants are closed on weekends. Ate at the 'Unbria' restaurant just across the street - - best steak I have ever had. It is pricey - but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms falling apart a bit.”
Reviews.Author: Stargzr99
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my two best friends in a one bedroom suite April 30th-May 1st. Room was nice and big, plenty of space for us to pack and unpack our bags as girls do. Shocked to see the couch cushions fraying more than a little bit. It was pretty disgusting and fiting more of a hotel 6 than a suite at the Hilton. Made me nervous about other sanitary issues.... AC for the humid nights that we were there was below par too. Flip side, one of the greatest locations you can get in Boston....walking distance to almost everything... Might stay there again if I found a great deal....also check out Urban Adventure Bike tours,...other than Fenway Park and Isabella Gardner Museum, best way to spend an afternoon...

Reviews.Title: “What a nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: LAPO76
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in this hotel while visiting Boston and I really had a pleasant stay. The room was a very good size, bed was big and comfy... I loved sleeping in that bed! I couldn't be bothered to leave my room in the morning! The people at reception were helpful and attentive. I really recommend this hotel if you want a central location, and you are looking for good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Hotel Near Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Boston Financial District is an acceptable hotel. Nothing particularly stood out about this hotel in either a good or bad way. The service was generally very good and responsive to our requests. The hotel is near the waterfront, Boston Aquarium, and other local attractions, which are all within a 10 minute walk of the hotel. The room we were given had a very small TV that was relatively far from the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Boston Financial District - great for leisure as well as business”
Reviews.Author: JP814
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Boston for the Marathon and had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton Boston Financial District. If youâ€™re considering staying here on vacation, donâ€™t let the name fool you â€“ itâ€™s obviously great for business travelers, but itâ€™s also a perfect location for leisure travelers. There is so much within walking distance â€“ Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market, the Wharf, North End, to name only a few â€“ and there are convenient subway stations to get you pretty much anywhere else you want to go in the area. The hotel is gorgeous, the rooms are spacious, the restaurant â€“ Caliterra â€“ is awesome, and the employees are incredibly friendly and helpful, something you donâ€™t always find in a big-city hotel. Thanks to everybody for a great experience, and I look forward to returning again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - walking distance to all we wanted to see”
Reviews.Author: happy2c
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean upon arrival and well maintained throughout our stay. The concierge was helpful and courteous and the front reception was very accomodating when we requested early check-in and late check-out. When I called in advance of our stay I was given detailed instructions for travel from the airport to the hotel. There wasn't anything overly special about room's features but, it was modern and comfortable. I liked that they had robes, hair dryer, iron and even an umbrella to use during our stay. I'd recommend this hotel for a nice stay. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey and Not Impressive”
Reviews.Author: miteub
Reviews.Content: This hotel is set in the Financial District, and is well situated as a launching post. My family and I stayed in a KING suite which came with a King bed, an uncomfortable roll-out couch, and we ordered an extra cot as well. The room was a decent size, although the reservation desk indicated we would have views of the harbor (we actually had views of the buildings next door). The carpets were a bit dirty, the bathroom was tiny with no fan, the TV's were dimly lit, and it took 3 calls to the front desk to get the cot we had ordered actually delivered. We paid $290 a night + $38 to park + $15 for Internet access + $45 in various taxes, so just add about $100 to whatever your room you are quoted. You get a free newspaper, but a cup of coffee by the front desk was $2.50 (really??) We almost ate breakfast there but it was $15 per person for pancakes, so we walked down to Dunkin Donuts for $20 per family. In short, not cheap, and not overly impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best experience”
Reviews.Author: NovemberTangoCharlie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Boston Marathon and have had better stays at Hiltons. I am a Hilton Gold and frequent world traveler. The rate is fair for Boston, and the location is good too. You can walk to the North End or other restaurants near by. There is good access to the Transit system making the hotel very accessible to the rest of the city. But, the staff was not the least bit accommodating with any request. We were told Breakfast was included in the room rate. My wife even asked the waiter in the morning if it was included and she said yes. After taking one bite, she came up and said it was $22 a person (a joke for fruit and cereal). After some uncomfortable discussion she decided to comp us. It was embarrassing. I sorted it out later with the front desk - they had forgotten to give my the hilton honors breakfast pass. Service was poor anyway in the restaurant, water and coffee only came after the bill! Rooms are small, dated and the TV and bathroom are lousy. I supposedly had a oversized room, I feel sorry for those in the regular room. Sheets and pillows were a little worn. Free Hilton Honors internet code changes at least daily and it is a hassle to call the front desk each time we needed it. 50% of the time, we were given the wrong code and other times the wait was so long, I hung up (no call back or apology). PS - There is a night club near by. The live band started Saturday only at 10pm and went till 3:00am. It was very loud and drunks were yelling in the street (we were on the 6th floor). OK it you want to party, but we were hoping for sleep before the race. This hotel is OK but well below Hilton standards for a destination like Boston. Checking out today and won't return next year.

Reviews.Title: “No”
Reviews.Author: LuljaNYC
Reviews.Content: The location is pretty good. Located on the eastern part of Boston, a few minutes walk away from the aquarium and from historical sites. The actual hotel is a waste of money. The shower handle shot out and water came gushing everywhere. They fixed it but just the fact that it happened is ridiculous. The front desk guy was very nice and helpful, so that made it a bit better. The whole floor smelt like pot the night we stayed. That same night, we were in the elevator with what seemed like homeless people, and they came off on our floor. Guess the Hilton lets anyone in! Don't bother with this hotel. Location is good, but there are definitely better for the price. It's too pricey for what you get (which are just headaches)

Reviews.Title: “A rained out sox game turned to an awesome trip to Bahston”
Reviews.Author: dacapella
Reviews.Content: Let me start this out by saying that we are a group of people who all work in the hospitality industry (in a small luxury hotel as well as a 4 diamond resort) who were traveling for a red sox game which unfortunately got rained out. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very professional and curtiorus staff that were friendly and genuinely interested in making sure that we enjoyed our stay not only in the hotel but in Boston as well. Not long after we got to the hotel we found out the sox game- was cancelled and the concierge staff jumped at giving us other options of things to do and where to eat. Edison the Front Desk Manager went out of his way to accommodate us. We forgot a camera in the car but Mike Collins who was part of the valet staff went out of his way to help us get the camera back and was very helpful with getting us to the nearest T station. Sam the bellman was also very friendly and always wanted to know how we were doing and how are stay was going. We will see you in August!

Reviews.Title: “Great room - very clean and spacious.”
Reviews.Author: Goochbird
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in the heart of the historic district. The rooms were spacious, well kept, and even had a mini fridge. Our only problem was a leaky faucet and some noisy, door-slamming neighbors. We chose to park at a nearby parking garage, which was recommended by the concierge, and that was a good deal for the weekend. The breakfast buffet was overpriced, but the service was great and the food was tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: calster
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned about the hotel secondary to the reviews, but I'm glad we booked here as the hotel was just fine. Every other Hilton property in the core area was booked because of the Yankees-Red Sox game. We arrived after the red-eye to a full hotel. I was expecting to leave the bags and go do some walking around the city before checking in. Luckily, they were able to accomodate us with a room right away. Love the front desk for expediting it and letting us know that no one had booked that specific room for the previous night. Able to get some shut eye before the day at hand. The front desk was so friendly and helpful. During the day, the housekeeping staff was amazingly helpful and accomodating. The entire staff from beginning to end was helpful and gracious. Admittedly, some of the furniture in our room was older, but it was tasteful. The room had one of the largest flat screen TVs I've ever seen in a hotel room. The sound-proofing was acutally excellent except for the teens next door trying to get into our room. Cleared that up straight-away :-) It is in the Financial District, so during the days on the weekends, it's pretty empty, but the walkability to all the attractions was awesome! We were able to walk to the Aquarium, Quincy Market, the North End, Chinatown, Boston Commons, etc. At night, the area is packed with college kids blowing off steam. I've never seen so many lines to get into clubs. It can get noisy and the testosterone can flow with some noisy "arguments" occuring outside the hotel. In any case, I would have no reservations in recommending this hotel to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but dated”
Reviews.Author: mrsjtaz
Reviews.Content: Great location for downtown Boston and the Freedom Trail. Also close to the lovely North End which has many great Italian restaurants. Our room was quite big with a large bathroom however despite having two windows it was very dark as the room was overlooking an atrium. It was clean and the bed was comfortable but the decor and amenities were dated. Overall ok and though would not visit again I do recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointment. Behind the times and needs to be updated”
Reviews.Author: Getme2snow
Reviews.Content: Not much more to say. The room was only fairly clean, and the carpeting was very stained and seen better days. Internet access in room is an additional $15 per day. TV was old tube type, thus no HD either. The Hilton Boston Financial District needs to be updated and amenities brought up to meet today's travelers expectations. This does not appear to be a 4 star hotel, 3 at best- and that is a stretch without today's expected amenitites.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Sel2223
Reviews.Content: Ok, so its not the best hotel (or the best Hilton) we've ever stayed in but its clean, the rooms are an ok size, the staff are helpful and its a great location for exploring Boston. How much time do you spend in your room/hotel on a city break anyway? If you get a good deal then there are a lot worse places wou could stay and we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if we are ever lucky enough to return to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SomersetFlower
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, at the start of our holiday travelling around Mass. The location is absolutely excellent, especially for the Quincy market area. We did not eat at the hotel so I cannot comment on that, but for a family, Quincy market offers all you need, morning, noon and night in the way of food for a family on a budget. Our hotel room was huge, we had 2 king size beds in the room and a larger than average bathroom. I think this room, being on the corner of the building may have been larger than average. It was also spotlessly clean. The hotel was quiet, there was no noise to bother us. The staff were very professional and helpful. We would definitely recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and service”
Reviews.Author: ccboater
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first time on 2-26-11. We booked a Saturday get away from the rat race. We found the hotel location very convenient to Quincy Market and The North End as they were only a short 5 to 10 minute walk. The hotel was in nice shape for an older Hilton. It is clean and well kept. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. We especially liked the concierge John M. He was very friendly and helpful as well as knowledgeable about the local attractions. He helped to make our stay fun by recommending the new Hollowing at the Moon night club. Weâ€™ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here..if you do not want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: gunns4sail
Reviews.Content: i had Hilton Hhonor points and deciced to take the family to Boston. We had adjoining rooms (suite/doubles) as requested which was fantastic. This was also a great location for walking around the town. The fitness room was minimal and quickly filled. I am surprised that a hotel like this would have so little equipment. All the good about this hotel was balanced by the extremely bad rooms. I saw the warnings on other posts but did not heed them. The walls are paper thin and you hear everything around you. The partiers came in at 2AM and we had fire alarms both nights. it was impossible to determine where the noise was coming from but you could make out the conversations and it was like they were in the room. The lack of sleep really ruined the vacation. Enjoy Boston but not from this hotel. Sorry Hilton, but you need to renovate or add pink-noise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to come back to.”
Reviews.Author: artieboy
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great concierge,and the morning coffee is back in the lobby!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outdated room, but friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Aurora1101
Reviews.Content: We went to boston for an overnight with a friend and my one year old. The subway was about a 10-15 minute walk weather from the State stop or Downtown crossing. The first impression was great- beautiful lobby, friendly doormen and frontdesk staff. The crib was already waiting in our suite. The one bedroom suite was large with a nice view, but there were stains on the carpet (crayon??), the toilet ran if you forgot to giggle the handle, and the decor was very dated. The "minibar" fridge was locked and we had to request a key, even though it was empty (we had baby milk and insulin that needed refrigeration)- it was hardly cold and didn't have a freezer. The beds were comfortable, with the standard Hilton sheets/duvet (which I like- I don't like hotels who don't change ALL the bedding between guests). We ordered in a Pizza because the baby was sleeping, and the menu price wasn't bad, but they added a delivery charge AND gratuity- good thing it was delish as it cost $30 after all was said and done. Breakfast was a great buffet with LOTS of fresh fruits. Over all, a nice stay for a night or two, but a week probably would have been tedious with the tiny fridge and long walk to the T.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff-closet to Fanueil Hall- Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: Leeward034
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful at this hotel which was great for travelers who do not come here often. They willingly offered directions and recommendations on food. Financial district seemed a bit dead (Sunday, Holiday on Monday, Tuesday) but was close enough to other attractions. A bit far from Newbury street but in great location to Fanueil Hall with many dining choices, drinks and shopping. Mr. Dooleys Tavern within a minutes walk is AMAZING with live singers and a real Irish/Boston feel. Top pub in Boston I thought and great to have so close to this Hilton. There are also an abundance of great pubs nearby as well if that is what you are after. The room was simple- Clean and comfortable king bed. The outdated TV from 1980 was strange but not a deal breaker. Curtains are not the best at keeping light out either if you are visiting here for leisure. My boyfriend booked this hotel and I was a little worried about what we might arrive at because this Hilton wasn't even on my list of possible hotels to stay at in the Boston area. Overall, I found this hotel to exceed my expectations for quality and feel. Inexpensive and effective.

Reviews.Title: “Understanding a extremely nice staff”
Reviews.Author: barbietec
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel is grate. All the must go-to stores are just around the corner and lot's of good restaurants. The hotel staff is extremely nice and understanding and our favorite door man was Brett who always gave us excellent advices what to do, ordered the best taxi's and told us funny stories. The room was excellent, but the beds are to small for two to sleep in so we got an extra one that was extremely good one for an extra. The Hotel was willing to accommodate us because the fire bell went off our first night and we give the Hotel extra points for that! They were also extremely friendly and helpful when one in the group got sick. We are going to stay there again! The least thing about the hotel is that the Internet access (WiFi) is not free and is to expensive to buy but it should be included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Always a convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: DitaV2
Reviews.Content: Rooms: good size, clean, good bed and pillows standard to all Hiltons Room Service: fast, responsive, always delivered hot and with courtesy Front Desk: superb, always remember me when I stay.

Reviews.Title: “The bartender Amy made our trip. She was great.”
Reviews.Author: thurston1
Reviews.Content: This note is long over due. We were there on 8/2010 room 731( Esposito/Thurston). Amy the bartender really made our trip memorable. We won''t stay any where else this coming summer. I hope see is still there. The hotel was great, location great, staff great. We tell every one to stay there when in Boston. See you in this summer! Thanks Gale Thurston

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rodjune
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and thought that the staff, hotel room, bathroom, size of room, heating, and cleanliness were acceptable. The subway station on State Street was about a 10 minute walk Check-in was a breeze and I was waited on cheerfully by the front desk staff. I was fortunate to have a corner room on the 9th floor which afforded more space and more natural light. I especially liked the bed headboard that had built-in overhead lights to make the room and bed bright and inviting. The bed was comfortable and had adequate lighting on the night stand. The room, due to its size, could have used another floor lamp but I was ok with the lighting as is. The desk area sufficient but made of a marble material so it was cold to the touch (wood would be better). There was sufficient lighting on the desk to do work. The TV was a nice flatscreen. There was also a coffee machine that worked well and made a decent cup of coffee. The bathroom was typical Hilton: adequate and functional, pleasant but not luxurious. The towels were thick and had an above-average quality feel. There were Crabtree & Evelyn amenities on the counter that I like, including shampoo, conditioner, bath gel, mouthwash, shower cap, and sewing kit. Not sure if there was a safe in the room as i didn't see one in the closet but it may have been in the TV cabinet, as most Hiltons I have stayed in do have this feature. I had breakfast at Calliterra Restaurant downstairst. The buffet was overpriced and didn't look like a good value so I ordered French Toast off the menu, which was extremely filling and tasty. The front desk was very helpful as I tried to make my way out quickly that afternoon and to the airport before the big snow storm of early February was due to hit Boston that evening and the next day. I would stay here again as everyone was so nice and customer service oriented. .

Reviews.Title: “Loud, smelly, dirty, old, uncomfortable.”
Reviews.Author: travellighteatheavy
Reviews.Content: Located in the financial district of Boston, this hotel reaps the benefits many other hotels do not have...location. Besides the fact that this hotel is a 1 minute walk to the subway, a walk to the North End, Waterfront and Downtown area, this hotel has not positives and the cons surely outweigh the pros. Hotel was old, which I am usually OK with if they keep it fresh and clean. Wall paper was peeling off the wall in large sections Only three small lamps lit the room! No main lighting in rooms! Bed = uncomfortable Heat = very very loud Room walls = paper thin so I heard everything going on next door and in the hallway Turned bath on and DIRT came out of shower. Tried to utilize closet but the doorknob fell off Trash smell in hallways never went away Breeze came through windows which made room very cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great Large Rooms, Convenient to Everything”
Reviews.Author: 3llamamama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoy a very nice stay at this hotel. Our room was large with a sitting area and separate bedroom. It was nice and clean and updated. Staff was extremely helpful. Easy walking distance to Fanueil Hall, Quincy Market, Freedom Trail. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Check your bill carefully”
Reviews.Author: Jasca
Reviews.Content: The most important tip that I can give to travelers who stay here is to double-check your bill very carefully. You will notice that they have bottled water in your room that cost $5.50 apiece -- a rip-off, so, don't drink them, obviously. However, you will notice a week later that you've been charged $11 extra on your credit card for the waters, even if you never touched them. It would be one thing if this happened once; however, it has happened to me several times. They are clearly desperate for $$$ and are hoping that business travelers won't notice extra charges on their bills. Other things: charging people $15 for internet service is a rip-off in a full-service corporate hotel. There is no free internet downstairs, as there is in most corporate hotels on the east coast; if you ask, they will act like you are trying to steal something from them. The restaurant for dinner is terrible and overpriced. Breakfast is OK, but ridiculously overpriced. The rooms are dingy. I have stayed at this hotel several times a year for more than a decade. It has gone horribly downhill since they changed from Wyndham to Hilton, maybe five years ago. The problem is that the Hilton (corporation) has far too much debt; to pay the debt, they've got to cut back on services to customers, really to a laughable extent -- i.e., they've actually removed flat-screen TVs and brought back the old kind! You're better off at the Marriott or at some of the newer hotels in Boston, even if they don't have the best location. Some of the staff are very nice, especially the night desk staff -- but they can't make up for the terrible service for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but watch out for sneaky charges..”
Reviews.Author: popsider
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just after Thanksgiving and were given a massive room, which was pretty modern, clean and comfortable. The location is great and convenient for South Station and Quincy Hall. My only gripe is that the hotel charged us $16 for using the mini bar when we never touched it. We were not told about this charge when we checked out and I only just noticed it on my credit card statement. To be fair to the hotel, they cancelled the charge as soon as I called but I didn't appreciate having to sort this out. Not what O expect from a Hilton and we won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in fantastic location with a few scattered issues.”
Reviews.Author: mvbruner
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights a few days after the massive snowstorm hit Boston during late December. We received a two-room King suite at the hotel and the room was very nice with a great view down to the harbor. However, on our first morning the melting snow caused significant leaking into our room and made the bathroom all but unusable. We informed the front desk and the hotel promptly responded and cleaned up the mess. Additionally, the housekeeping staff did not clean our room on the second morning of our stay. Other than the minor irregularities we experienced the hotel was very well located and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Would have rather stayed in my room if I could.”
Reviews.Author: HareWeGo
Reviews.Content: Rarely I issue full five points (Excellent) for all services in any review. However the Hilton (Boston Financial), broke that rule. As a disclaimer, this was only a single night stay, however in the span of one evening, the location, staff, room, and overall quality of the hotel made me wish my stay would have been much longer. Hotel well located in the financial district, walking distance to Faneuil Hall Marketplace. The one room suite was very clean and well stocked with all the necessities, (towels, toiletries, etc). Bed was fantastic. Upper floor room was very quiet. There are other amenities I was unable to enjoy, however with this one experience, I expect to return to the Boston area and enjoy a longer stay at this Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you get a nice price.”
Reviews.Author: ShrimpBucket
Reviews.Content: 4 days before departing for Boston i saw the prices and it was 400 a night... It's absolutly out of that league. If ou get a price about 200 a night is fine. I got a room with a nice bed, a very old TV and cheap furniture. The Gym is a room with some gym stuff. Location is very good. Breakfast is mediocre. Good for enjoying the city but not a remarkable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great off the beaten path, right downtown”
Reviews.Author: Maisqueporra
Reviews.Content: What a gem of a hotel, nice staff, great rooms, and a super location minutes from Fanueil Hall, museums, the T, and places to eat. A real gem

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was the BEST, will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Traveltime52_10
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, concierge very helpful, room was very clean and lots of room, very accomadating,convenient location to shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton gave us a wonderful anniversary weekend in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Lmarsh4444
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Boston was in a great location; we took the train into North station, which turned out to be a very walkable district to the hotel. We were greeted at the front desk by a very friendly and helpful young woman; when we booked the hotel we told them that we were celebrating our anniversary; to oujr surprise when we checked in we found out that they had upgraded us to a huge, beautiful suite! The suite was incredible, beautiful and clean. The bedding was extremely comfortable and great quality. On top of the suite upgrade, they also threw in a buffet breakfast for both mornings, which was quite good. Faneuil Hall was less than 5 walking minutes away; the 'T' was a couple of blocks. We had great weather so spent the weekend walking to most parts of Boston, and taking the 'T' when we got tired. It was a great weekend at a fabulous hotel in a great location. Things we liked least about the hotel were quite minor; 2 of the lamps in the room had dead lightbulbs, and there could have been better lighting in the living room. The bathroom was quite small for the size and luxury of the suite. Also, no free wireless internet in the room were a definite negative. Things we liked the most were the location, friendliness and quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: sportytraveler89
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is conveniently located to attractions, the hotel itself is disgusting. It may appear ok at first glance, but the staff is terrible and the housekeeping staff does a horrible job. On the first night in the hotel, my friend found someone else's socks in her bed! Yes, that means they never changed the sheets from the previous guests! When we called the front desk to complain, they only offered to give us a complimentary breakfast. And that was only after we complained, first they accused my friend of lying! Horrible service, disgusting hotel! I will NEVER stay here again and Hilton will only be an absolute last resort in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel within walking distance to downtown destinations”
Reviews.Author: jsylestine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the weekend of November 5, and it was great. We got a great deal on Priceline and came away very happy. The hotel is a few short blocks away from the Blue Line (to/from the airport) and Red/Green lines (other Boston destinations). We were initially booked for two double beds, but upon arrival we asked for a king size bed and were accommodated with no questions. The room wasn't huge, but it was more than adequate for an easygoing couple like us. The hotel shows its age in some spots, but overall it's a great value. Again, its greatest asset has to be its location. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: aiacono
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at this hotel travelling by myself. It's very close to subway and walking distance to main attractions. Just minutes away from Quincy Market and Faneuil Hall. I walked everywhere. Also close to the harbourfront as well. Hotel was clean and linen was excellent. No worries about bed bugs. My room was tastefully decorated. Desk staff was very courteous and helpful. I did not use their restaurant, but it looked nice and welcoming. There also was a nice sitting room that you could read. Shopping is great in Boston. Excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Accomodation, and Location”
Reviews.Author: R&G-Opine
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough about the quality of service at the Hilton Boston Financial District. Attentive, gracious, freindly, the list goes on. Superb early 20th century art deco building (if you like that kind of stuff which we do) Room was large and light filled. Only negative is noise from the street. Single pane 80 year old windows don't do much to drown out the sounds of construction or worse, late night revelers. Ask for a room as high as you can get. Excellent location. Could not really be better. 1/4 mile to Freedom trail, Quincy Mkt, Etc. Need a pint? Walk out the door and go North South East or West for 100 Ft. We did not park. I'm sure it's cost prohibitive. We ate breakfast buffet which was excellent. Hints: We took the MBTA subway from Logan to Aquarium stop less than 1/4 mile from Hotel for $2 each. Cab is $20-$25 Take the train to Haahvuud Yahhd. Beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Below average service & indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: drewbles
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many Hilton properties, I expect a friendly efficient service from what is considered a good brand. This property was a let down. Initially, things went smoothly. Check-in was fine, as a HHonors Gold member I was informed with an apology that they did not have an Executive Floor to upgrade me to, but put me in a 1 bedroom suite and offered me a complimentary buffet breakfast and the usual wifi vouchers. This is where the good things ended. The room had issues. Initially, the phone in the living room did not work. They sent someone up to fix the phone, and then some 6-8 hours later it just started randomly producing high pitched beeps (which in turn woke me up). In addition, the guest compendium was empty (as in someone had removed the pages). It took 3 phone calls and 2 people to come up to my room to actually understand what I was requesting, and deliver a full compendium. I also had cause to contact and visit the front desk at various stages later in the evening during my stay. To say the night staff were next to useless would be an over-statement. The night manager basically said nothing to my requests, or as little as possible. They treated me like I was putting them out of their way and disrupting them being lazy. One particular staff member was so bad I wrote a separate complaint to Hilton about them. I also witnessed a lady in obvious distress attempting to get a room late one evening. When they informed her she was not able to get a room without photo ID she became upset and aggravated. She ranted a little bit about 'if I get murdered tonight, it'll be on your conscious' to which the night manager replied "That's ok Ma'am, I have no conscious". I've never seen such rude staff. Would I stay there again? Definitely not by choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable accommodation, moderately priced”
Reviews.Author: Hampshirecouple389
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights having booked through HotelsConnect in the UK at what appeared a very reasonable rate for such well located hotel. From the moment we arrived we found the staff very friendly and helpful, the hotel was very clean and our room, although it overlooked the central courtyard, was large and comfortable. It perhaps appeared a little outdated but it was in keeping with the original art deco style of the building. The bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom was quite large, well-equipped with one of best showers we have ever used and the toiletries a pleasant surprise. A flat screen television would have been preferable but we were not in Boston to watch TV. We ate in the restaurant, the staff was attentive and the food was enjoyable. Breakfast was very good. We would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel let down by poor restaurant staff”
Reviews.Author: empty186
Reviews.Content: Waited 5 minutes to be acknowledged and seated at what was a used table. Crumbs and stains on table cloth and on water glasses. Changed table to clean version. Waited 15 minutes with no acknowledgement by staff. Only 4 parties in room. Went upstairs and ordered room service.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: szlamany
Reviews.Content: We got bed bugs from this location - room 923 - on Aug 16 of 2010. Brought them home - cost us $1200 to clean our childrens bedroom. $329 for the room - and this is what we got for it! And I see on the web that other people found dead bed bugs during this time - so they knew about it but never considered calling those families that might have been in infected rooms. How irresponsible!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, very, expensive”
Reviews.Author: cjbushman
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton for two days on a business trip. The hotel is in a good location downtown within a block of many of the historic sites. The hotel room was quite large and comfortable. Overall, it was a good hotel experience. The price is very expensive. I paid $399 per night which to me, wasn't worth it. A couple of colleagues stayed 10 minutes away by taxi in Cambridge or near the airport for much less. The exterior of the hotel seems to going through a perpetual construction. Scafolding essentially made the whole sidewalk and front look shabby. This did not look like a $399 per night hotel. There's not much of a lobby at all. I probably would not go back here due to the price and construction. Besides the expensive price, they still charge $15 per night for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ah8898
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel at least five times in the past few years. It is very close to Boston Harbor and Faneuil Hall. My husband is a Hilton Diamond member and we always get upgraded to a suite. The only negative is that the rooms don't have a flat screen tv.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Hedleymom
Reviews.Content: The room was small although the bathroom was surprisingly large. Internet access costs $15 a day! The location is quiet at night because it is in the middle of a business district. The bed was comfortable. The TV is the old style non HD and had no disc player.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kravman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located for the business and leisure traveller. Booked through priceline at $125/night, this hotel offered unbelievable value at said price. Location: 5-10 minute walk to Faneuil Hall / Quincy Market, 10 minute walk to the shopping district (including the "Downtown Crossing" subway station where one can catch a 10 minute subway ride to Cambridge/Harvard Square and a 15 minute ride to Fenway Park), 15 minute walk from the North End (Boston's little Italy with fantastic restaurants - I would recommend Strega on Hanover Street - a small and quaint restaurant offering an exciting atmosphere and some of the best Italian food I have ever sampled) and a 20 minute walk (5 minute cab ride) to the "original" Cheers location (note that the bar bears little resemblance to the TV show and that there is a Cheers located closeby in Faneuil Hall). Hotel: The staff are exemplary and truly did everything in their power to ensure that we had an enjoyable stay. While the hotel is clean and the amenities respectable, I will concede that the rooms are beginning to look dated. Notwithstanding, I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston and would not hesitate to stay there again. Parking: Parking in the hotel is extremely expensive ($35-$40). There are several buildings in the surrounding blocks that offer parking for cheaper, one being the Intercontinental located on Atlantic Avenue (parking on the weekend is $9/day).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Wedding at the State Room”
Reviews.Author: Travelmaven1
Reviews.Content: We had a suite. It was quite large, high ceilings,plenty of windows, and comfortable furniture and bedding. The rooms did not have a flat screen TV. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was well located for the wedding we attended at 60 State Street. The breakfast was very good with excellent muffins. We would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: sdavi
Reviews.Content: This past weekend we stayed at the Hilton because we were talking my daughter to see Wicked for her birthday and I had enough points to get one of our rooms free. From the moment we arrive to the moment we left the staff was excellent. As we were checking in, the staff found out that we were celebrating my daughter's birthday so they gave her a free movie. Our free room was a corner room that was very large and has an excellent view. The bed was very comfortable. The location was great; we walked to Quincy Market and the North End. Our waiter for breakfast was excellent; he ensured we all had fresh, hot food from the buffet. My only complaint is paying $38 for valet parking and $12 for Internet access but I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: sunset129
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews I was concerned, however I feel I must have stayed at a different hotel as our stay was wonderful. Location, Location, Location, just a few blocks from the harbour to get on the trolley bus , Quincy Hall and we walked from South Station on arrival to Boston. Front desk, concierge and bell boys were are very helpful and friendly, no problem getting a taxi. After spending a night in a small New York hotel room it was a pleasant relief to have a spacious room with a decent sized bathroom, I do agree with the reviews that the televisions are very old and need updating, but hardly used it, who goes on vacation to stay in their room and watch TV?! We had a problem initially with trying to get the shower on, the room phone didn't work and no hairdryer, however within 30 minutes of my complaints these we all resolved to our complete satisfaction. Breakfast service was very good, no waiting at all. They were doing some renovation to the outside of the hotel but this never affected our stay. There are a few good bars around the hotel, we enjoyed Brandy Pete's for a great sandwiches and drinks, the Italian district is great but beware extremely busy on weekends, so book a table somewhere. Looking forward to staying again, as I have said in my other reviews it may help if you are a Hilton Honors member?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJADAMS61
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and very well located. Just a short walk to Quincy Market and all those great restaurants in North End. Very helpful staff made our trip even better. Beds just perfect, soap, shampoo at very high quality. Will stay there next time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Jaws2fan
Reviews.Content: Being in the financial district, there is harldy anyone walking around. Untill you get to the shopping market and food market. In the food market ther is LOTS of choise of food and its cheap!!!! Unfortunately, my hotel room was 2 doors away from the ice machine so all night all we could hear was people going to get the ice! Oh Well!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a night in the city......”
Reviews.Author: katefromboston
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using the bid feature on Price Line.com so I really feel as though I got my moneys worth ($150 including taxes) for my night in the city. The hotel is a short 5 minute walk to Quincy Market/Fanueil Hall and a 10-15 minute walk to Hanover Street in the North End. It is also in close proximity to the T stops, both green and orange, so it is VERY easy to get to Fenway as well (which is why we got the room for the night). :) The rooms were clean and comfortable with a large bathroom. As other reviews have stated the room came with the old tube style television but it worked fine for the 20 minutes we actually watched it. When in Boston watching television is the last thing that I am thinking of doing. All in all, a great value for my Red Sox weekend. :)

Reviews.Title: “Poor Conrad Hilton would cringe at what this property has become....”
Reviews.Author: Ex_Lux_Astrum
Reviews.Content: It didn't bode well that the smarmy reception clerks were in constant denial about the condition of their property. This hotel is old and tired....why Hilton Worldwide does not renovate their property, located in the financial district of a major US city, is baffling to me, and should be embarrassing to them. After I questioned the staff of why my AC was not spewing cold air, they went through the charade of sending a technician to my room, who informed me "it was working fine..." I guess "fine" means that 82 degree AC is normal. After I pressed the arrogant staff for a tad of honesty, they admitted that the HVAC system was indeed over the hill. As apparently, was the TV. The antiquated television would have been considered a relic back in 1989. The icing on the whole cake was when I inquired why only 2 elevators (out of 6...maybe 8) were functioning....and incredibly, was told "...a guest must have broken the others by pressing the buttons....." Unbelievable!! Long story short, the fact that this hotel has a great location does NOT compensate for an arrogant staff trained to lie, and a depressing, overall shabbiness to the property itself. You'd be better served staying at the newer Hilton Logan airport property that provides free shuttles to the subway, ferries, and buses, and has a Skyway directly to Terminal A.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, cosy Christmas.”
Reviews.Author: 1987RoseC
Reviews.Content: I was visiting the States for the first time over Christmas and New Year 2009/2010. For several reasons I couldn't stay with friends over Christmas itself so my parents gave me a hotel stay as a present. I would not have booked the hotel normally but it was on special offer (Â£49 per night for a twin double room) and for a solo traveller over Christmas, really worth the money. I'd never stayed in a Hilton before but was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was easy to find and a short walk from the bus station - particularly helpful at 9pm on Christmas Eve when you're in a strange, snowy city! When I arrived the staff were friendly and helpful, checked me in with the minimum of fuss and offered me a complimentary hot drink. As other reviewers have mentioned, the hotel is shabby at the edges and my shower pressure was fairly non-existence, but the room was spotless and *enormous*. I was on the twelfth floor in a corner room with a lovely view of skyscrapers around. On Christmas Day I had breakfast in the restaurant and the waiter was really lovely - there weren't many people around and he kept chatting to me and even lent me his iphone to look up local newspaper sites for events. The food was also quite nice, although I wouldn't normally pay that much for what I received. The Internet access was hideously expensive, but I encountered that a lot on my trip, the only exception being an awful hotel in Queens that I wouldn't ever stay in again! Any time I had questions the staff answered them and they made several good recommendations. The hotel is a good place for exploring Boston and, as it was the holidays, was very quiet being in the financial district. The latter meant that it was a trek to get something to eat in the evening - possibly seemed longer because of the cold weather. On the 27th people started work again and I lost the privacy I'd previously enjoyed - more people in the hotel and I opened my curtains to come face-to-face with office workers in adjacent buildings. If you can get a good deal then I recommend this hotel for quiet holiday getaways - I didn't feel homesick and a lot of that was due to the friendliness of the staff and the cosiness of the surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: hmorse9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended up with a room here after naming our own price on Priceline. We got the room for $125 plus tax, which made me happy after seeing the $200+ rates on the Hilton website. I was hit with the first disappointment upon arriving; we got to the hotel around 4:15 pm, and the line to check in stretched all the way down the entrance and nearly out the door. It took nearly 40 minutes to get checked in and up to our room, which was very frustrating. On the way to our room we had to contend with four different housekeeping carts blocking the narrow hallway. The room itself was ok. It was a bit dark and gloomy, but it was updated and modern looking. The bathroom wasn't all that clean, which was another disappointment. Also, the prices at the on-site restaurant were extremely high, even for a large downtown hotel. Another minus is the $38 fee to park at the hotel. On the plus side, the hotel is in a great location, and there are plenty of sightseeing and dining options within walking distance. The valet Brett was extremely nice and helpful in giving my husband and I directions to the subway station so we could get to the game at Fenway Park. We also enjoyed that fact that check-out wasn't until 12 pm, meaning we didn't have to rush to pack up and leave. Overall, I would stay here again simply for the convenient location--but only if I got a good rate through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and the King Bed Suite was fine for our family of four.”
Reviews.Author: Mark_in_SD
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (twin 16-year-old daughters) was looking for a central location in Boston to serve as our headquarters for a week's stay. We found this Hilton to be perfectly situated, close to many historical sights and near the T. We arrived late, around 10:30, and were checked-in quickly. The restaurant was closed, but Israel, the bartender/waiter helped us with a good selection of appetizers and clam chowder to satisfy us after a long flight. More importantly, he made us feel welcome and suggested a number of activities for the next morning. A good start! The hotel room was very comfortable and relatively roomy for a downtown hotel. The high ceilings with crown molding made it particularly nice. The sleeper sofa, while not great, was satisfactory for the girls to share. The king bed was great, and we slept very well, except for the one Saturday night, when there was a noisy wedding crowd being particularly obnoxious with no consideration for the other guests at the hotel...no fault of the hotel itself, but noteworthy. The staff was consistently attentive, and we were always very pleased to return from our day's activities to find a perfectly cleaned/organized room. The housekeeping staff deserve special recognition! All in all, we had a great visit to Boston, and the Hilton was a major part of the pleasurable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Average Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Schwawi
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at this Hilton in June 2010. Seemed to me to be an average business hotel, most suitable for business travel. While the location is very good, I probably wouldnt view this as a first choice hotel for family trip, just doesnt have that kind of feel to it. Rooms are large, but a bit gloomy. Carpets in the rooms need to be replaced (I had to switch rooms in the beginning because the carpet was just too stained to be tolerable for a week's stay - the second room was better though, but still felt a bit worn). There are a number of good restaurants around the hotel - the neighborhood is nice. I would certainly stay there again if on Business and my meetings were nearby, but I wouldnt stay here as a holiday destination.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, O.K service.”
Reviews.Author: mickosull
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights with family and the location was perfect for sightseeing. 2 tube stations within 4 min walk which will take you anywhere you want. 3-4 min walk to waterfront, aquarium and quincy market. 7-8 min walk to boston common. The room was big, clean and comfortable although a bit dated. The staff were friendly and helpful. My main complaint would be the internet was $14.95 for 24 hrs, when most modern hotels give this for free. I would stay here again for the location,

Reviews.Title: “It's ok, but I wouldn't choose that hotel if I were on holiday”
Reviews.Author: BobLind
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the hotel while attending a conference in Boston. Most of the hotels had full occupation due to this huge conference, plus I've been told that May is graduation time, so that was the reason for accommodation being so expensive at that time ($180/night). Overall, the hotel is nice and clean, and the staff helpful. Great bed and bathroom, but the room was small. TV didn't work properly. Surprisingly, there was no safe box in the room. I think I wasn't lucky with the room I got since it was an inside room so it was kind of dark. A colleague got another room (opposite to mine) and it was much better. I've been to Boston a couple of times before on holiday and I wouldn't choose this hotel, or any hotel located in Financial District, for that purpose. Although it is located just a couple of blocks from Faneuil Hall, the area at night is deserted. I think Back Bay or Copley is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Shiny on the outside, grimy on the inside.”
Reviews.Author: Deagol100
Reviews.Content: Travelled with a diverse group of colleagues from around the world and arrived to find the reception completely mobbed. One of the party had elite status and supposed to be able to express check-in at Hilton group hotels but this hotel doesn't seem to care. He asked concierge who just blanked him. We then found the hotel had completely messed up reservations and refused two members of the group the second night they had booked. No apology for this, just said it wasn't their fault!? Lobby area of the hotel is very classy looking. However, lifts take forever, going up is ok, trying to get back down....take the stairs! Rooms very disappointing, my bed had all the electrical sockets behind the matress! Very dark and dingy. No complimentary bottle of water, just two bottles for $4.50 each and both of them where nearly a year out of date!!! Internet access $14 per day? In a hotel that seems to be aimed at business people? Any one of these faults would normally not upset me, no hotel is perfect and I understand that but added together it was just unacceptable. Everyone of my group (8 people) said we'd not only not stay there again but this experience would make us hesitate to book any hotel under the Hilton name.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great location, stinky service”
Reviews.Author: StinkyPeteOhio
Reviews.Content: This was a great hntel for a family weekend in Boston. It's in walking distance (if you are in decent shape) to shopping, Little Italy, and the waterfront. I booked and paid for our room ahead of time scoring a great rate! The accomodations were perfect and we had a great time in Boston. Unfortunatly our service wasn't great. Our room didn't get cleaned until 5 PM leaving us with lots of garbage since we were towing a newborn with us. We also called the front desk to get a wine opener, and no one ever came. Room service was pretty affordable and the staff attempted to be helpful. We were just disapointed by those two things.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mntrwtt
Reviews.Content: Great location for anyone going to boston to visit. everything was at walking distance. Although there was no view (just another building) it was clean. the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in Boston at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: eferone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for our first visit to Boston and were very satisfied with the experience. We got it at a good rate on Priceline, Boston hotels seem to be relatively expensive. The location is very convenient, after taking the T from Logan Airport we only had a few blocks to walk from the Aquarium stop (Blue Line), which is only 2 stops from the Airport stop (there's a free shuttle from the Terminals to the T). Its also nicely placed for access to bars and cafes (although some cafes didn't seem to be open on weekends) as well as tourist attractions like Quincy Market / Faneuil Hall. The hotel itself is a lovely old Art Deco style building, and the rooms are decorated in sympathetic style: at first our room seemed a little dingy but the muted gold and brown colour scheme grew on us and seemed in keeping with the building itself. The room wasn't especially big but was fine for us. Whether you like this hotel probably is very much down to individual tastes; the decor, the lack of flat screen TVs in the rooms and other modern trimmings will not suit some people, but I felt it had a nice character and appealing ambience about it. Carpets in the halls, lobbies etc. could have been a bit cleaner. Staff were competent and friendly though we had no especial need to avail of their services beyond the routine stuff. We did not eat in the hotel so I can't comment on the food, but there are plenty of options in the neighbourhood. Another reviewer mentioned it being a spot for bachelorette parties (or hen parties as we call them in this part of the world); I was awoken a few times on the Saturday night with noise from the hall, not the worst I've ever experienced by any manner of means but something worth bearing in mind if you're a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “bedbuts”
Reviews.Author: bbroown3333
Reviews.Content: My manager just returned from a 2-night stay in this hotel. He has bug bites all over his arms and legs. He was told by the hotel when he complained that they were spider bites. i don't think he will stay there again. I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here in the summer if you want a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: AshCarter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is famous as the site of summer bachelorette parties since it is walking distance to the bars of Quincy Market area. My family (including my then-eleven month old) had the misfortune of being assigned to the room next to one party last summer. Despite multiple calls to the front desk, the hotel did nothing to request the noise level be reduced. Nor did the hotel have any issue with more than 20 people in one hotel room (all of whom could not have been registered guests.) Finally, at 1 am, I demanded we be moved to another room. We packed up our groggy 11 month old and all our luggage (and the roll away crib!) and moved to another floor. No suites were available so we were downgraded to a standard room with the crib shoved at the foot of the bed. It was a terrible experience (both the noise issue and the lack of any response from the hotel management). I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, poor room”
Reviews.Author: TravelerGirl102
Reviews.Content: First of all I would like to say that the staff was extremely friendly. However, the room had a broken phone, a shower that didn't drain, the clock in the hotel room was incorrect so we nearly missed a baseball game (tickets were very expensive), and the TV was from the 90s with a tiny screen and poor picture. Also, beware of the VERY expensive breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “I would return if visiting Boston again for leisure purposes”
Reviews.Author: kwa829
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very happy with this hotel and would likely return to it if our leisure travels took us back to Boston. Positives: - Biggest plus is location, location, location. In some cities, you'd worry that a hotel in the "financial district" would be in a ghost town on evenings and wekeends, but quite the contrary here, there was a lot of life and people and things going on long after the nearby office towers emptied out. There are a number of restaurants and pubs nearby (literally a half dozen Irish places within 2 minutes of the front door). North/South/Quincy markets. Aquarium, "Freedom Walk", the Big Dig greenway, and other touristy stuff is just a few minutes' walk away. - "T" (Subway) station (Aquarium station) is a 3-minute walk . . . and is just a two-stop ride from Logan Airport staion. - Bedding and towels were crisp and white - Bed was extremely comfortable - Room was very clean - Ample bathroom amenities were provided - Room was fairly quiet by the standards of central city hotels. - Not a lot of kids stay here; it seems to be a hotel for grown-ups. Negatives: - The hotel is an older one, elevators seemed a bit clunky. - Television set came straight out of 1990; not much channel selection; channel labels were incorrect. - WIndows in the room did not open. Both Positive and Negative: - The fitness center is in a somewhat musty basement . . . but the equipment was very good. Frankly, if the weather is conducive to it, opt for a run outside along the waterfront instead . . but do it in the morning before the waterfront walkways get too crowded with tourists. Advice: - Avoid the outrageous $14.95/day Internet charge by walking about 75 yards to the nearby Panera Bread Company, whcih has free wireless (open 6 AM to 8 PM weekdays, 8 AM to 7 PM weekends). And while you are there for your morning email check, eat there too, thus avoiding outrageously-priced hotel breakfast food. - Don't even think about renting a car if you stay here. You can get to virtually all major Boston tourist attractions quickly, easily, and cheaply by subway, bus, ferry, and foot. And the "T" blue line is the best way to/from the airport ($2 subway vs. $20 taxi, your choice). - If you venture out for a walk, have a good map with you; it is easy to get lost in the maze of Boston's Financial District with its crooked, narrow seats that are not at all directionally-aligned.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here. Do not book this hotel. Stay away.”
Reviews.Author: Ultraplur
Reviews.Content: WARNING, DO NOT STAY OR BOOK THIS HOTEL: This hotel will overbook its rooms (in other words, breach your hospitality contract and sell your room to someone else, even if you fully pre-pay your stay) and then attempt to waive its responsability. In some jurisdictions, selling the same thing (the right to occupy the room) twice, is considered fraud. Would you like to stay in a hotel that behaves in this manner? I did not think so... In my many (over 30) years of travelling, many of which have been for business travel around all continents and staying at hotels of all levels, from small family owned hostels to high-end Asian ultra-luxury palaces, I had never experienced such an unethical and illegal behaviour as the Hilton Boston FInancial District. This hotel does not honor its basic contractual obligations, even when stays ave been pre-paid. Leaves no option but to sue in court. The hotel does what is equivalent to you staying at the hotel and, then, in the end declaring that you are not paying for the stay, despite the contractual obligation to do so. Do not run the risk, stay elsewhere. There are plenty other ethical options in Boston. DON'T SAY I DIDN'T WARN YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay..Why so many bad reviews??”
Reviews.Author: Vermontersvacation
Reviews.Content: I was worried about coming here as it was one of the few hotels downtown Boston less than 300 dollars and the reviews were not kind, but it was fantastic. We had six people in two rooms for my sons graduation and everyone loved it, Friendly people, GREAT location walked to Boston Gardens, Fanuel Hall, ate dinner at Legal Seafood. Rooms were spotless, gave us a late checkout, halls were spotless. Sent us a little note a few days before asking if we needed things like extra pillows!! How sweet! Beds were great, we asked to switch rooms so we could be closer and they were so kind about it, saw Boston Harbor from the window. What is wrong with these people who gave bad reviews? The night before we were at a Crowne Plaza in Mass that was disgusting for the same price. I would return to this hotel anytime! My only complaint was 38 dollars to park the car!! That is the most I have ever paid to park a car, go to public parking it is right around the corner, 15 dollars a day.

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: beachmandublin
Reviews.Content: 3 weeks, 8 hotels, one long US holiday.. this place managed to come in bottom of a list of places we stayed which ranked from sensational (the Mandarin Oriental, Miami, to sublime (the Belfry Inne in Cape Cod). How the name Hilton is above the door in this Boston hotel was beyond us. The gloomy room was a little box where you tripped over the end of the bed (too big for the space) as you came in the door. No view, small window facing a drab courtyard, no charm, no sense of staying at a Hilton. It looked and smelled like a two star hotel (carpets could do with a change of scene). On the plus side, staff were very nice, restaurant chef does a great breakfast but no amount of charm can make up for the absolute letdown you will feel when you walk through the lifeless doors here, We followed this with ten days of staying at lovely innes and hotels across New England, We swung back through Boston and stayed at the Sheraton, in our view a significant step up on the Hilton for roughly the same kinda money.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - we would return”
Reviews.Author: missmilly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights from Apr 10th, we arrived early for check-in and were pleasantly suprised to receive an upgrade to a king suite. Lovely spacious suite with 2 bedroom areas, small kitchen area with mini-bar fridge/coffee making facilities and decent sized bath/shower room. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. The location is ideal for the North End and Quincy Market and a short walking distance from Downtown/Boston Common areas, plenty of restaurants in the nearby area. We had an enjoyable stay and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend This Hotel...Great Customer Service, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: vicjbrad
Reviews.Content: My family and I were very pleased with our stay here. We arrived 3 1/2 hours before check-in and were nicely accommodated. Everyone from the valet's to the doormen to the front desk were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and clean. We had a 2 double bed room, beds were very comfortable. Great value with the family fun promo (tickets to the aquarium). Excellent buffet breakfast in the morning. I would go back here and I definitely recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel, great location for...”
Reviews.Author: Aquacarpet
Reviews.Content: Great business hotel, great location for tourists as shopping is all around hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place to stay for the Boston Marathon”
Reviews.Author: PasadenaJulie47
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this Hilton for the Boston Marathon. The hotel is both close to the airport and the starting and finish lines of the race. It is a close subway ride from the airport, and the start/finish lines are within walking distance. If you would prefer not to walk the half mile to get to those points, there is also subway transportation to those points. The hotel itself was nice, clean and the staff was friendly. It seems a little overpriced for the quality of the room, but that is typical in a big city. The fitness center is tiny and there are no showers, do not rely on this if you want to get a good workout in or if you hope to use it to clean up after running the marathon. If you are there just for the running, this is better done outside in the safe and scenic neigborhood. Do not rent a car if you are going to stay here, the public transportation is all you need to get around the city of Boston. The restaurant and bar at the hotel are great, nice atmosphere, good food. Happy running!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: LoveLife82
Reviews.Content: Not worth it. I booked through American Express Travel which is required by my work. It was over $300 a night for five nights. My room was very small. Somewhat standard for a city room. I read various reviews before my stay and was expecting a much larger room with a better view. Needless to say, my Hilton honor's status may have gotten me on a "honors" floor but the room was less than desirable with no view, especially for $300 a night. Room service was standard- food was decent but out of this world expensive. House cleaning was standard, although they never replaced the two complimentary water bottles after the first night. The biggest disappointment was not being able to take a hot shower the whole time I was there. It was horrible. I woke up dreading the idea of showering knowing full well that I would be taking a cold-no water pressure shower. Also, the idea of spending $14 for internet in a business hotel seems ridiculous. Hilton should rethink this policy... There are many other hotels in the area, please stay somewhere other than Hilton. I am a very loyal Hilton Honors member but I was very disappointed with this hotel. I recommend walking around and taking the T. I was able to do some exploring and eat some great food. Everything from seafood to Quincy Market comfort foods. Venture over to Newbury street (Arlington/Boylston St.) which is right off the green line about three stops down from the Government Center station. If you are looking for a quick bite, there is a Panera Bread right down the street and dunkin donuts and starbucks are everywhere. This hotel is centrally located but for $300 plus a night, definitely not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: fpfosi
Reviews.Content: I spent the night at this hotel on my way to a ski vacation. My friends and I had wonderful dinner, and a relaxing night. We had to leave very early, and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible”
Reviews.Author: stri6
Reviews.Content: Notice how all of the good reviews are from years ago? There is a reason for that. I stayed at this hotel last night and it is totally run down and dirty and not at all what you would expect staying at a Hilton. There were plastic wrappers and pieces of trash on the hallway floors, the elevator key cars and room key cards barely worked, the wallpaper is peeling of the wall, the curtains are broken, the rooms are old and dingy, the shower water temperature is barely warm, and I could go on and on. I was talking to the bartender at the bar across the street and told him how shocked I was about the state of the hotel and he laughed and said, yeah, everyone says that. It was the worst $250+ room and hotel I have ever stayed in. I have to go back to Boston on more business trips in the next couple of months and I will certainly be staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: xamarshahx
Reviews.Content: I got a suite which was very cheap for the size of the room. It had two double beds in a separate room and a sofa bed in the living room. Also a small kitchen type area (sink). The staff was generally friendly, but I think the door staff was there to hustle us, they would not let us take alcohol to our rooms saying it was hotel policy, I didn't feel like dealing with it so I just gave the guy 10 bucks and he let me "sneak" it in. The location is good, except it can seem really quiet on the weekends since it is the financial district, but at night the bars in the area are busy and packed. Quincy market is a 10 minute walk and has pretty much all the eating and shopping you can do there. The rooms were nothing spectacular, but generally clean enough and comfortable. Not on par with a Hilton, but it was fine. The main draw was the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, spacious and comfortable room - Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: happy_fairy
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Financial District Boston is just great! It is a short walk away from Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market, Boston downtown, a Legal Seafood Restaurant as well as the T Train stations (Aquarium and State - Aquarium is on the Blue line - same line as the Logan Airport). The room we had was spacious, comfortable, clean and quiet (despite being close to the lifts). Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Can't comment about the food as we did not try the restaurant. Overall, this is our third stay there and we go back to Boston, we will try to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly.Spacious -would return again and again”
Reviews.Author: jula81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel for 4 nights .Staff with curtious and friendly at all times,Hotel was clean and had great atmosphere.Room was spacious ,had a beautiful sea view,beds were comfortable and loads of room in the bathroom.Its is ideally located- a short walk to restaurants,bars , shops, trolly tours and harbour.Food in the hotel itself was excellent .Would recommend to friends and family and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with superior service”
Reviews.Author: G_is_for_Go
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Boston Financial District. From the moment I walked in, I was offered service beyond my expectations. The bellman offered me coffee, they upgraded my room, and provided complimentary breakfast both mornings. I was given a hand written letter upon check-in welcoming me to my first visit to this Hilton property. Every employee that I encountered during my trip had a smile on their face and were extremely friendly. My daughters and I walked to the North End District, and everything else was just a ride on the "T" away. The beds were very comfortable and the room was huge for Boston's standards. We dined in the hotel restaurant for the breakfast buffet. My daughters and I are all very "picky" eaters, but there was a wide variety of food for us to enjoy. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel because of the great service, the location, and the value and overall quality of this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location but too close the clubs”
Reviews.Author: buck7715
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to the hilton for it's close location to the northend. After a nice valentines dinner we came back to the room to relax. To our surprise the heavy base and club music started around 11 PM and lasted until...well it's still going Bring your ear plugs or request a room on the opposite side of the music

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice- Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: npresnall
Reviews.Content: We booked this all line and when we got there was pleasantly surprised. Close to airport, walked everywhere. Place was clean, nice and awesome spot. Some noise from bars across the street but not big deal. The bars in the area were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice find in Boston”
Reviews.Author: TravelLib
Reviews.Content: After reading past reviews, I wasn't quite sure what I was going to encounter during my stay at the Hilton Boston Financial District. I must say, I was very pleased with both the hotel and the staff. The room was large (sometimes unusual in big city hotels built in the 1920's) and very comfortable. My one complaint was the distance from the TV to the bed--the old style tv made it difficult to watch tv from anywhere but the chair, unless you wanted to crank up the volume. The bed was delightfully comfortable. And housekeeping was great. The staff was friendly, yet very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Needs refubrishing; parking is a rip-off, good value through priceline.com”
Reviews.Author: Bulgarian_travels
Reviews.Content: I booked via priceline.com for 120$ per night, which was a decent value considering the location. If you are not a business traveler though and canâ€™t run your carâ€™s parking through the company expense account, do NOT stay here if you are driving in Boston. The overnight rate for parking is 35$ but if you check in before 6pm they add up to 12$ on top of this amount, and if you check out after 8pm, they add up more money on top; easily could end up paying 50$ for a 24 hour period. The alternative I used was the Public Winthrope Parking Garage which has max 20$ per 24 hour period, but is usually full on work days. I joined a line of a few cars waiting for free spaces and got one in about 20 min or so in midday. If you have time but money is scarce, I recommend you take the same approach. I checked in around 11am (check in is not until 3pm) which was appreciated. I was given a large corner room which was pretty nice. I would repeat though the other fellow travelers in saying that the hotel is very old and in a desperate need of refurbishing â€“ particularly the exterior, the common areas and elevators. The rooms are old but not as bad as the rest of the building. Service was good, check in was brisk, no complaints there. Internet is additional, wireless also available, and cost about 20$ with taxes. All in all, good for the money, but if money is a priority, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: springsteenisgod
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this hotel or the staff. We spent three nights over Thanksgiving and were made to feel really welcome.Reception staff were welcoming and check-in was quick. The room was very spacious with the luxurious Hilton mattresses on our king bed. Furnishings were good, usual bathroom facilities, dressing gowns etc. Hotel was in a very convenient area, with Downtown Crossing, Fanuel Hall and Boston Common all within walking district.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: pbh73
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on a recent business trip. Great location. Good staff. Room enormous with a well appointed bathroom. Breakfast was very good too. Couldn't fault it. My new first choice for Boston FD.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay over New Years”
Reviews.Author: nickss1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel (for the second time in two months) with some friends in a suite for New Years 2009/2010. Having stayed in regular room in November, I knew what to expect from hotel. This time was in a suite on the 6th floor at front of facility. As mentioned elsewhere, the hotel is just a very short walk from aquarium 't' stop. Just 2$ from logan airport. Check-in was a breeze. Suite was big enough for us all - 3 adults and 2 teenagers. Small kitchen area, although no microwave or fridge, which would have been useful. So close to everything, very good for new years fireworks, on Common at 7pm, and then a very short walk to habour to welcome in the new year. As I've written before, I usually stay at the Omni, but if the deals keep on at the Hilton, then it's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service, excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: mwalno
Reviews.Content: Arrived early (around 2 pm) and was helped by Jade at the front desk, she was brilliant as it was busy and the phones were ringing off the hook, but she took time to ensure I was satisfied and fixed my reservation (I had pre-paid for one night, and used points for the second). She also got me a room early. Please see my blog at http://talesfromtheroad-mwalno.blogspot.com/ In room 427 which is a VERY NICE suite and located in one of the corners - so it is VERY quiet. Nice size room when you walk in with a hide-a-bed, old style tv, table with 2 chairs, and a sink (or "wet bar"). Spacious bathroom located through a door that can be closed and then the master bed room. This is a great room, flat screen tv, quiet and dark in the morning. We had several adults and kids in the room for New Years eve, and we could not hear the room next to us, or anywhere else in the hotel. Only minor beef was the lobby bar's drinks seemed to be noticeably higher, and I got whacked $30 for a roll away (and it was small and on its last legs). We always love having breakfast in the lobby restaurant, but I will write a separate review on that. They were GREAT in allowing us to have a 2:30 pm check out for our 4 pm flight.
