BEST thing about this property is the PEOPLE....everyone is helpful and goes out of their way to make sure you are happy...everyone from the maids, to front desk, and especially the guys who work the door. Can't ever beat the location and the service is first rate!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a nice district allthough it seems to be a little worn down”
Reviews.Author: Hjalti_se
Reviews.Content: We got this as a deal with a Icelandair package to boston with 4 nights in the beginning of December. The service and the bookings came in really well and I had nothing bad to say. We had a great King size bed and it made our stay very comfortable. The area surrounding the hotel is full of bars and restaurants. Fenuil Hall is only a 5 minute walk away and it takes you just about 40 minutes to walk to prudential center. The room we got was nice and large but it was getting a little worn down and we had the Aircondition intake for the entire house right outside our window and when that thing started it woke us up every time. So good hotel but is getting a little old. I would recomend it for a weekend romantic getaway but not much more then that

Reviews.Title: “Superior City Hotel at reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: MoverDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel, good accomodation and very helpful staff without exception. Would recommend to all classes of traveller whether business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for business, great location close to restaurants and tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: anya98
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. All new amenities. Rooms a bit small but it is in the financial district. The staff friendly and nice. Very clean and helpful. Would come back for business and is okay for a few days because of convenience and location but if I were staying a few days extra and had family would choose a different hotel. Everything is near by, the wharf, the public gardens and tons of great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: weekender011
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic for seeing the city. It is in walking distance from just about every part of town. The staff is friendly and accommodating. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jerseyians
Reviews.Content: We got our hotel reservations through Price Line so my view may be slightly skewed since we paid 1/2 of what the normal rates are. That being said, the location was great for us. We were allover the place from little italy to chinatown and found that walking to these areas took about 20min. I was also surprised that the size of our room was quite large, usu. in downtown areas the space is ltd, but i do believe we had a corner room. My main complaint was the bed was uncomfortable, now I dont know if that it was just our room, but my husband also complained that his neck and back were sore. We were so busy w/ our short wkend that we didnt think about switching room,s but by the 2nd nite - I actually got up and slept on the floor - that's how bad it was. I'm hoping that it was just our room, b/c everything else re: this hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: artgaldm
Reviews.Content: I do not think I have ever given a bad review, but for the money we paid, this was not a good experience. We booked two nights this past weekend. The room was fine, but our bathroom had no heat at all. Instead there was an old, rusted electric heater under the sink that we did not even find until the second day. For a Hilton this is unacceptable. Second, we ordered room service and added 2 very expensive coffee cocktail drinks. They were advertised to have fresh chantliiy cream and strawberries with the drink. They came with nothing and when we called we were told that "most guests like the drinks black". If that is the case, why describe the drink differently on the menu. They then sent up a pitcher of regular cream and a strawberry on a plate. This all would have been OK to ignore, however, on the second day we left our room at nine AM for some sightseeing. We made sure to take the "Do Not Disturb" sign off the door. When we returned to freshen up at 1 PM the room had not been cleaned. That was fine as the staff were cleaning an adjoining room. We went out again at 1:15, returning at 4. The room was still not made up and there were no housekeeping staff to be seen. We called the front desk and waited. No one came. We then went down to the front desk and were told that we would have to wait another 40 minutes for our room to be ready. All in all we did not have access to a clean room to relax in until well after 5PM. Terrible. For the money this was a HUGE disappointment. With the price and the fact that parking is $38 a night, we will go to another hotel the next time we are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline deal....”
Reviews.Author: bigdog1582
Reviews.Content: We got this at a good price on priceline... "name your price". We figured out that we saved about $90.00 bucks.... It was very clean, and very comfortable.. king size bed, huge bathroom, dryer, coffee, TV.. all the comforts... Room was small, (no biggy, we don't need a huge space)..parking was $38.00... (wow),,, And we were very surprised that there was nothing open around the hotel when we got back from the Theater...Alittle surprised that they charge $4.50 for a bottle of water that was in the rooom... Hubby didn't read the HUGE label on the bottle..lol.. However,,, It was very clean, & nice, Staff was helpfull and very pleasent. Liked the fact all we had to do is step out and grab a cab...

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, don't expect much on the weekends”
Reviews.Author: CTA76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Hilton over the Halloween weekend in 2009. Since we were booked via Priceline, we were guaranteed a room that would sleep two people. When I showed up at the front desk to register, they wanted to place my wife and I in a two double bed room. When I asked for other rooms, they found a king sized room for us. (In retrospect, I found it odd that the hotel wasn't very busy yet wanted to put it in a two double room. We never saw anybody on the floor we were on) Interestingly enough, our room was on the 8th floor and was above a very loud club. It was pretty annoying for the first night, but you got used to it pretty quick. Other than that, this hotel isn't really for leisure travelers as it's really (I mean really) dead on the weekends in the general area. Given another opportunity, I would recommend staying in the Back Bay area. Also, we never really brought this up with the hotel, but the sink in the (large) bathroom always took a long time to drain. It wasn't the end of the world, but annoying none the less.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, clean and conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: thundertravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the weekend and wonderful accomodations. The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. The location was great! We were about 2 blocks from the Boston Public Garden and were able to walk everywhere. Additionally, one of the subway lines was less than a two block walk

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hilton I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: jktrip5
Reviews.Content: There are 6 elevators but only 2 in service. It can take 5 minutes to get downstairs and the elevator will be packed in the morning. I had to ask for soap and toilet paper, the first time for that in a Hilton. Call the front desk and you are put on hold not to be picked up. They want your money but service is nonexistent. The stationary bike in the fitness center was broken.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: doggiebus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before a flight. The hotel is an old building that has be totally redone. It was nice to see they kept some of the old things like the mail shoot on each floor (which you can't use now) when you come off the elevators. Because its an old building each room is a different size. We had a huge room with high ceilings, but I could see on the map on the back of the door that there were other rooms that were much smaller. The beds are very comfortable, plenty of lighting in the room and over the beds, mini bar, newspaper in the morning. The bathrooms are pretty standard (same shower head as the Ritz). The only complaint I have is the towel holders in the bathrooms were not properly secured to the wall with the right drywall screws. So the towel holders wouldn't stay in the wall. Location wise its pretty good, not to far from everything and its on a quiet street which is really nice in the morning. The next morning we walked in the drizzle to the silver line (instead of the blue line on the T) which goes directly to the airport $2 each. Staff said taxis would be between $20-$25 to the airport. Take the silver T its an easy walk, and you will save money. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cupcakegirl5
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice. Very quite on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: shmoogator
Reviews.Content: The thing that made this hotel stand out for us was the location. Downtown Boston and within easy walking distance to Quincy Market, North End , Wharf and Subway stop. Rooms are a tad on the small size, but have everything one needs and why stay in the room when your going to see Boston.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Content: spent 5 nights at the hilton financial district. very good location. fabulous helpful pleasant staff. good size room. large bathroom with bath as well as shower. would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good room layout with small kids.Great location to sights and restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: AP_Chicago
Reviews.Content: We visited the last week of August with our 4 yr old twins. In our initial search, we wanted a hotel with an indoor pool. However, our main requirement was a separate living room from the bedroom so our kids could nap/sleep and we could be watching TV without disturbing them. We looked at lots of hotels with suites but TOO expensive, even adjoining rooms were ridiciously costly. This Hilton may be considered a business hotel but it was the perfect set up for us. One bedroom suite: Separate living room, bedroom with 2 queen/full beds, and I think it was around $250/night. Every other option easily double the cost. Walked everywhere- Aquarium (5 minutes), Fanueil Hall (5 minutes), north end (10-15 mins). Only time we took a cab was back from the shopping area east of Boston Common/Garden. Never used the T. One negative on Saturday night, you could hear the pulsating music from at least 3-4 bars within a block.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost.”
Reviews.Author: mymanren
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a random weekend in September with my girlfriend. The staff at this hotel was great and responded to all of our requests. The hotel is located in downtown Boston and is very close to many attractions. The amenities in the room were about what you would expect from a Hilton, but certainly not worth the cost. The TV in the room was from the 1980s, and the volume limiter was set so low I could not hear the TV over the air conditioning. The hotel was also undergoing construction and because of this our entire view was blocked by scaffolding. The room itself was on the small side, but I guess this is expected for an older hotel. My biggest complaint was the noise on the street. Because of clubs and bars nearby the streets were noisy until about 3-4 in the morning. The noise was so bad even though we were on the top floor (15). I hope the windows are being upgraded in the construction because I have lived in downtowns of major cities my whole life and I've never been this disturbed by street noise. I would not return to this hotel unless we got a great rate. It is definitely not worth the cost. Plus the cost of internet was a little too high for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Dark room, noisy aircon”
Reviews.Author: Heidelbergman
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel. My room on the 8th floor was very dark even at noon, and it was very noisy. Even with the aircon switched off there was persistant noise from a huge air duct outside. No pool, expensive room service, expensive internet access

Reviews.Title: “Bit Below Average Hilton, You Could Do Better”
Reviews.Author: hawkdog
Reviews.Content: Hotel is tired. It was OK when it first opened as a Wyndham 10 years ago b ut has gone down hill since Hilton acquired. Rooms need to be redone. Carpets are a bit stained. TV's are horrible, old 20 inch tubes. The bathroom was the nicest part of our room. Service was uninspiring. Not bad for an overnight but not a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: BoulderAreaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week as home base for trips to Cape Cod, New Hampshire and Rhode Island. Pros: Stellar location - walking distance to Faneuil Hall, North End, Aquarium (and T). Incredible service in the hotel restaurant, CaliTerra, especially at breakfast. Excellent WIFI reception, even on the 15th floor. Small, but modern rooms with bright contemporary bathrooms and typical Crabtree & Evelyn products. Cons: $38 parking - however, the valets are very nice, and they provide quick service and directions (plus, parking ANYWHERE in downtown Boston is ~ $40). Fitness center only has free weights, treadmills and elliptical - it's ok, not great. Greatest scar is the cleanliness of the public areas. I doubt the areas around the elevator lobbies on each floor saw a vacuum the entire week we were here. The rooms are very clean, public areas - not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking”
Reviews.Author: rm996s
Reviews.Content: For a Hilton I expected a little cleaner room. I checked in and found mold in the bathtub and hair in the sink. The internet connection also kept going in and out. The location was pretty good but the staff could have been better. All in all, it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Classy at the best location in the finantial district”
Reviews.Author: hazinheira
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at the Hilton Boston Financial District. Classy and clean, respecting the Hilton standards. The rooms are maybe small but very well decorated and with everything you need. The staff not very warm but quite helpful. Good location, a few minutes away from the Market and Faneuil Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Location, service had highs and lows”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boston Hilton F.D. for part of our honeymoon for its location, and because it was free with Honors points. Upon arriving the clerk (manager, I think) was tremendously friendly and outgoing. He learned it was our honeymoon, congratulated us and upgraded us to a King suite on the top floor with free breakfast every day. This guy was top notch. The rest of the staff, particularly the restaurant crew seemed spread too thin the whole stay and customer service suffered. The rooms are standard Hilton issue, nothing extraordinary, the fitness facility is sub par, and the restaurant has a great buffett. The area is surrounded by bars and can be loud, but the location is tremendous. You can walk from the hotel to anywhere in the North End, to Beacon Hill, and to Back Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Was probably state of the art when it was built but not any more”
Reviews.Author: MMmd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the financial district. It is an old hotel that was probably state of the art when it was built in the early 20th century. Unfortunately this shows and the bussiness traveller (which this hotel is aimed at) will probably find better standards nearby. Our room was small, dark with little natural light, had only 2 small windows, was noisy and was looking at the innert side away from the road. Other colleagues on different floors asked to move because of the noise and poor quality of the rooms but the replacement rooms were exactly the same. There is no safe in the room and if you want one, you have to use one behind the consierge on the ground floor. The restaurant coped very poorly at breakfast when it was asking residents to share tables but in the evening it was virtually empty.

Reviews.Title: “Guess they still haven't fixed the AC”
Reviews.Author: kayakmore
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for business and this recent trip to the Hilton Financial District was less than impressive. The AC in my first room wasn't working, but there were not more rooms available. The manager was kind enough to bring me a fan and took the charges off for that night. I was moved on the second night to another room where the AC wasn't much better. The bathroom in the first room was less than clean, and the tubs in both rooms were rather slow to drain. Also, the recently mentioned construction is still underway, but noise was not a factor in either of my rooms. On the plus side, the fitness center was above average for a hotel. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyC12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the financial district, so it is quiet on weekends, but you are literally blocks away from Quincy Market, the T, the aquarium, the Harbour and comfortable walking distance to Boston Commons.

Reviews.Title: “Work Going On At The Hilton Boston Financial District”
Reviews.Author: billyboy07
Reviews.Content: Work in progress at the hotel which is partly covered by scaffolding and green netting. No prizes for guessing where our original room was. What is unacceptable is that there is no indication of the work mentioned on the hotel's website (and still isn't at time of writing). We would have taken another option if we had known. The hotel's front desk at check in were keen to point out that Hilton aren't doing the work, but that it's being done by the City of Boston. Expect loud drilling all over the building from 9am-3pm.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: ATL23
Reviews.Content: My primary consideration for choosing this hotel was its location. I was pleased with the convenience of the subway and convenience of the city attractions. I booked a reward stay and encountered no problems, though the staff were rather indifferent. I had requested early check-in, but was only able to get a room 30 minutes before the normal time, and this was after continuously asking the front desk. The hotel appeared to be renovating the exterior as the view from my room was of scaffolding and a green mesh tarp. The room was decent, though the carpet could have used a good cleaning. It is not a hotel I would have stayed at paying full price and have received better service at their lower-tier Hampton Inn brands.

Reviews.Title: “No air conditioning on floors 9-13 and they lied about it repeatedly”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: The air conditioning had apparently not been working for 2 days on floors 9-13. Despite this, when I checked in , the blower was blowing warm and humid air but the maid insisted the a/c had kicked in. A call to the operator came with a report that it would be fixed "momentarily". The charade continued with more lies and denials. The next day the front desk claimed there was no problem and said I just needed to set the thermostat to 60 and I would be fine. They finally admitted: the air conditioning system was broken on floors 9-13 and had been for 3 days (with no idea of when it would be fixed). Did they ask if I wanted to change floors (to a room where it was working)? No. Did they apologize for the misinformation campaign? (No) In short, there is no excuse for allowing guests to check into a room when the air conditioning is broken where other room with working a/c are available. Guests should be offered a room on a floor where it is working or moved to another hotel. Happily, the windows opened in the hotel allowing fresh air in. I asked for and received a partial bill credit. Despite this problem, the location was indeed great, the room was clean, etc. But having to spend my time arguing with staff that there was a problem (when there was) was annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and convenient location to everything”
Reviews.Author: TxAggieGirl
Reviews.Content: We had a king suite on the 9th floor -- it was a corner room so we could look out and see the water just 1/4 mile away or so. Not a lot of it, but our friends that stayed in a waterfront hotel said they could see less water from their hotel than we could! There were huge windows in the rooms with nice heavy curtains so we had the choice to let in a lot of light or none. The room was really nice and comfortable, and it was nice to be able to spread out in the bedroom and living area. The bathroom was smallish and we would have liked a small refrigerator for bottled water and such, but you can't have it all, right? They let us check-in early when we arrived at 1 pm, which was nice, and the concierge was great for giving directions and recommendations on the quickest way to get places. It was also nice to have an ATM in the lobby. This hotel is located in the Financial District, so it was very quiet on Friday and Sunday nights. Saturday picked up noticeably, but don't even think about finding anywhere for breakfast nearby on weekend mornings. The only main drawback. Is within walking distance to Boston Common, Freedom Trail, Faneuil Hall, the waterfront, etc. Great location! Nice comfortable hotel and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: blimele
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Financial district. Good hotel in good location. Unfortunately when we booked the hotel we did not notice that the hotel has so many different type of rooms, and we should consider next time to book a larger more comfortable room. Friendly stuff, all in all a good stay

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: dadsasdasd
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell: I wasnâ€™t that impressed with this hotel. Maybe I was expecting too much based on these very favorable reviews hereâ€¦ So certainly not a bad place but not a five star luxury hotel as such, just donâ€™t think it is in the same league with e.g. Conrad or Four Seasons. Review is based on a five night stay in Juneâ€™09 (background of spending 80+ nights per year in different hotels around the globe) Location: Walking distance to subway & underground streetcar (Green Line), waterfront and Faneuil Hall, i.e. good location for doing almost anything. A number of restaurants & bars (especially Irish bars) just nearby. Room: As HHonors Diamond member I was upgraded to a corner suite in 11th floor. Suite upgrades are generally rare so was pleasantly surprised to get it. Welcome package included two bottles of water and a small selection of fruits. Frankly when stepping in the first time I thought I was in the 70s Showâ€¦ Iâ€™m no fan of Ã¼ber-modern minimalistic boutique hotel style but this one was pretty much on the other side of the scale, i.e. very traditional with shades of beige and brown, regular â€œtube TVâ€� etc. Nothing wrong as such but if you are looking for something modern then this is not your place. Though after spending five days there it didnâ€™t feel that bad anymore :-) Suite was certainly big enough, especially the sleeping room. Living room had a small kitchenette, couch and table with four chairs. Not much of a view from either side of the room (though in downtown hotel you cannot expect much). No safe in the room, unfortunately. Suite (as rest of the hotel) was very clean and well kept. Noise from the street was quite clearly heard even in 11th floor, so beware of garbage truck arriving at 5am! Service: One could expect a lot from AAA Four Diamond hotel. I have to say my expectations were not fulfilled, nothing to complain about but nothing exceptional either. Maybe as European I donâ€™t know the rules of tipping game well enough? Etc: Lobby is quite small, can be get crowed. Breakfast was OK but Iâ€™ve seen also better breakfasts in some other Hiltons. I.e. not too bad but nothing luxurious as such either. 7 day internet access for $50 worked very well, no problems whatsoever and connection was fast, too. Elevators were probably original ones from 20sâ€¦ For example it was quite impossible to see which floor the elevator was going due to extremely dim lights used in the buttons. Thereâ€™s no Executive Lounge in this hotel. Would I return there? Yeah I could, depending on the price since I didnâ€™t have any major complaints as such. Just have to say that I couldnâ€™t call this hotel â€œgorgeousâ€� or â€œreally lovelyâ€� as some other reviewers

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hilton Experience”
Reviews.Author: kc_concord
Reviews.Content: We live in the Boston metro area. Stayed here with my wife for a weekend getaway without the kids. This is a standard Hilton - we like to stay at Hiltons because we know they will be clean. This stay was no exception. White duvets are always nice. But there is nothing else really to write home about. Location is very convenient to the aquarium and to fanueil hall. We parked at post office square since it is only $9/day on the weekend and is only a couple blocks away. I wouldn't rave about the Hilton Boston Financial District but it is a safe dependable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel- easy walk to 3 different T line stations, excellent upgrades”
Reviews.Author: farawaymum
Reviews.Content: I have completed a 5 night stay and liked this hotel for the following reasons: *you can walk to State, Aquarium or Downtown Crossing T stops which will get you everywhere you need to go (the 7 day T pass at $15 is a bargain- even for shorter stays it will easily pay for itself), *its a 5 minute walk to Faneuil Hall which has lots of options for food, from there its not too far to the North End which is a must do for Italian restaurants and pastry shops, *the benefit of being in a quieter part of town (the financial district) is that its easy to sleep- no traffic noise at night, *I was given a great upgrade to a suite as a diamond Honors member , together with a full breakfast and a welcome amenity (fruit plate)- in summary - fabulous treatment for diamonds- better than the other Hilton hotels in Boston, *service was attentive and responsive throughout the hotel, *rates were good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “4th time back, still as good”
Reviews.Author: CSIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again in Nov 2008, first time staying since it was taken over by hilton but the standards are still as good as when it was a wyndham hotel. Location is perfect, its in the financial district but only 10 mins walk to downtown crossing, Rooms are big and spotless. Beds were very comfy. T stop(aquariam) is 5 mins walk from hotel, we got the T from Logan to hotel. I recommend this to all my family and friends and I will def go back.

Reviews.Title: “The doormen know my name - I'm a regular”
Reviews.Author: froggerATL
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for at least one week of each month for the last five year. The positives - it is really easy to walk around Boston from here - minutes to Quincy Market and the Common, close to T stations etc, its recently remodeled and the remodel was a good thing. Rooms can be small or ridiculously large depending upon which room you are assigned. The suites are awesome. The gym in the basement is very nice. I was skeptical since it is a basement gym, but each cardio machine has its own tv and there are enough dumbbells to keep me busy. The negatives - sometimes the rates are really high, the food at the restaurant is just okay, the remodel is still ongoing in some places and there are weird quirks like fire alarms going off and periods of no hot water. Overall its a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In a word, underwhelming.”
Reviews.Author: iaa
Reviews.Content: If anyone asking me how my stay was, I would say "fine", but nothing more. I was in town for running the marathon, and wouldn't recommend this hotel for that, as there are other, nicer hotels, a lot closer to where you'll want to be. The location for other visitors to Boston strikes me that it would actually be pretty good. My room was "fine", but if I had to say what disappointed me the most, it would have to be the service, and in particular, the front desk. Nothing seriously wrong, just not terribly pleasant and no more helpful than was absolutely necessary. I certainly was not paying the rack rate, but at the same time, didn't really feel like I got value for money. I thought that a financial district hotel charging per hour for Wifi or wired internet access is embarrassing. The interior of the building is nice enough, and the exterior is really quite striking. All told, I thought this hotel had a lot of potential, which for my money, went largely unfulfilled.

Reviews.Title: “Expect to pay for everything”
Reviews.Author: Blomsterpistol
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Hilton in Boston's Financial District. Over all I had an ok expericence (although I would strongly advise everyone to stay well away from the rooms next to the ice machines!) but given the fact that this was a Hilton Hotel, I expected more. Perhaps too much. The hotel has everything a four star hotel is supposed to have. Just don't make the mistake of thinking you can have any of it for free. Nothing is included in the price for the room, which means you pay for breakfast, internet and also I had to pay 10 dollars to print out one(!) copy of my train ticket. I don't know if this is standard for Hilton Hotels in the US, as this is the first I've stayed in, but I have to admit that I felt somewhat ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - nice people”
Reviews.Author: jayseetoo
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Sunday. Note that the Financial District is quiet at the weekends! The welcome from the lady on reception was warm and this set the tone for all of the staff we met. The doorman in particular warrants mention. He offered to get me a coffee from the restaurant as I sat and waited for the rest of my family after delivering one to a lady with little kids sitting in the lobby ( much to her evident surprise and delight!). The room was a good size with comfortable beds and nicely fitted bathroom. Crabtree and Evelyn bathroom goodies too - nice choice. THe hotel is a couple of minutes from the historic Fanuiel Hall and Quincy Market ( which are right next to each other). We visited the Aquarium - 5 minutes walk away - and it is really worth a visit no matter what age you are. We bought a City Pass for 5 attractions. - Museum of FIne Arts, Prudential Tower, JFK Library, the Aquarium and Harvard Museum of Natural History. Well worth the money and all worth seeing. My husband celebrated his 50th birthday while we were there and we had lunch at the Bristol Grille in the Four Seasons at Boston Common that day. The burger was one of the best I have tasted and the complementary birthday cake with candles was a lovely touch. Boston is a beautiful city and staying at the Hilton Boston was the icing on the cake :-)

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE ITS A NO-BRAINER”
Reviews.Author: itbetterbeclean
Reviews.Content: Prepaid thru Hilton website got $99 per nite weekend rate. Park the car at Garage at Post Office Square, 2 blocks away - 3 min walk (they have website) its indoors, clean/safe and only $9 a nite on weekends (Hilton wants $38). When you walk back to Hilton stop at upscale bar Bond in Langham Hotel. Go to breakfast at Panera Bread it cost under $10 for both of us, versus a $22 breakfast buffet pp at Hilton. With all the money you just saved, take T, 1 minute away from Hilton (Aquarium Stop) to Newbury Street and take your wife shopping. When you get bored go to Joe's American Bar for lunch. Other reviews about Hilton are pretty accurate, yes it can get loud from bars on street, we were on 7th floor, and I did hear the garbage truck come at 5am to pick up the trash. The lack of towel rack in shower is odd, but king bed is extremely comfortable, Faneuil Hall is 1 minute away, Catholic Church is 5 min walk, and $99 in a 4 star BOSTON hotel is a great deal . Staff is very good, and requests were filled very quickly. Tip maid every day, its worth it and you get better service over people that don't.

Reviews.Title: “Be afraid, be very afraid”
Reviews.Author: bus_visitor
Reviews.Content: Some of the rooms are so noisy as to make sleeping totally impossible. This is due to the constant loud grinding of machinery (not guests, cars, etc.). It is the type of noise you might not notice until you've unpacked, got into bed and turn out the lights. Then you have to decide if it is worth getting up to change rooms or if you just might actually fall asleep after all. Even some of the normal tricks (turning off heat & ac; closing bathroom door to muffle its fan do not work. It might be rooftop fans or nearby buildings or something else but it doesn't matter - the net result is you cannot actually sleep in your hotel room. There might be other rooms not afflicted with this so if you do end up here be extremely cautious and give the room a real test.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT stay”
Reviews.Author: nicolasjclement
Reviews.Content: January week-end is a slow period as confirmed by the hotel employees. This certainly allowed the reception to upgrade us to a nice corner suite even with a rock bottom prepaid rate. Location is very (too) quiet on week-ends as it's the financial district but a 5/10 min. walk will get you to many Boston hot-spots. Friendly staff. Few downturns were the fee for internet use (Marriot's free), the fact they forgot to replace a stained bathrobe I volonturay left on the floor. My compliments to the Concierge and the front desk staff for their great assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful wonderful wonderful”
Reviews.Author: canadianchick75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove 15 hours from Ontario, Canada to stay at the Hilton in the Financial District. We were in Boston for the first time to meet with friends who were there on business and for pleasure. After traveling such a long distance, we were delighted with the hotel. The maid service was wonderful. We personally met our maid and she was a lovely woman..so friendly. We also asked for a second icebucket and within minutes a new icebucket filled with ice was in our room. We only had two issues: the parking for $38 was crazy. If we would have known that near by there was an all day/all night parking for TEN DOLLARS per 24 hours, we would have certainly parked there instead. Also there was one member of the concierge at the front desk who was less than friendly. I went up to the desk and said hello to her..she wasn't on the phone and didn't seem busy. She just blankly stared at me, said hello back, and looked down at a book in front of her. However, a very helpful young woman came up to me and smiled and asked how she could help. I was unhappy with the first young lady because I was a guest there and paying good money and was basically treated with disrespect. The library in the lobby area was gorgeous. A lovely place. The hotel is situated near everything you could want to see and everything was in walking distance. The city itself was beautiful. The people we met by chance in the streets were so incredibly friendly. We loved the atmosphere of it all. They have every type of cuisine imaginable as well with out walking too far to find it. There is no doubt that we will return to both the Hilton and to Boston several times.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: pennyrPlymouth
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a fabulous 4 day break at the Hilton with 2 friends. The hotel is in a wonderful location near the Aquarium and it was easy to walk around the beautiful city of Boston. The staff were ALL very friendly and extremely efficient. The room was enormous and very comfortable. The whole hotel was spotlessly clean. The only (tiny) negative were the lifts which didn't want to stop on our floor although there were engineers working to sort this out. We caught the subway from the airport (less than $2 each with a Charlie card - staff at train station only too happy to help). The stop for the Hilton is called "Aquarium" and then a short walk to the hotel which is easy to find next to the tall clock tower of the old Custom House. We did not eat in the hotel but there are lots of places to eat in the nearby Faneuil Hall. I would thoroughly recommend the Hilton to anyone and hope to return in the summer to enjoy the city when it's not covered in 3 feet of snow!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: treeisme
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly staff, clean rooms, great location. My compliments to the GM

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel All Around”
Reviews.Author: JBien
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Hiltons when I travel for business because of the sheer number of them available; there's a good chance there's a Hilton near the customer I'm traveling to see. This visit, I dragged my husband with me since this month was busy as far as business travel goes and I was tired of being away. (Dragging hubby with me is sort of selfish - it makes the business trip go easier for me) :) What a gorgeous hotel! We stayed at the Hilton Boston Financial District, and being a Hilton Honors member, we received complimentary breakfast coupons for the two days we were there. That was a nice touch. Check-in was mostly hassle-free, though our room wasn't ready when we arrived, so we had to wait about an hour and a half. We had lunch in the hotel restaurant CaliTerra to kill time, which ended up being a really nice treat. I had a personal pizza for lunch, while my husband had a grilled turkey panini that he enjoyed. Upon checking in, the room was immaculate. Gorgeous furnishings, impressively-made bed (I love the Hilton Heavenly beds), beautiful bathroom fixtures/decor; this hotel was beautiful all the way around. There was the bed, a nice sitting area with a TV/armoire, and a comfortable chair and desk. Housekeeping offered turn-down service. They freshened your room as well. That's a great touch, to be honest! To see the bed (which is inviting anyway) dressed for you to snuggle deep into the down comforter with the cold weather howling outside ... it's almost irresistible... Room service was actually the best I've had in a hotel anywhere. I had a fantastic spinach tortellini in a cheese sauce, while my husband had a frou-frou pizza, and we split a caesar salad. "Frankie the Yankie" delivered our food and was so funny to chat with. The kitchen was actually quick to deliver our meal, I was pleasantly surprised. The workout room was beautifully equipped, though the equipment needed a good cleaning. There were three Precor brand treadmills, two Precor brand elliptical runners, and two recumbent-style Precor brand bikes. Each had an entertainment system with headphones so you could either listen to music or watch TV while you worked out. There were also some free weights and a few pieces of universal-style gym equipment. Unfortunately, there was virtually no room to stretch on the floor or do yoga, though there was a yoga mat. There was also no water within the gym; you had to step out of the gym (take your room key with you) to drink from the water fountain outside the gym. The hotel was located a few blocks from the State Street T, so it was a short walk away, though dragging your suitcase through downtown Boston was tough, with the crappy ruddy narrow sidewalks. The State Street T can take you virtually anywhere you need to go so the location was great. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. -Jen

Reviews.Title: “Yes, we liked it,too.”
Reviews.Author: quiltlover
Reviews.Content: After many years it was wonderful to come back to Boston. We enjoyed this hotel and itÂ´s location very much. As lots of others have said already, all stuff is great and helpful. The concierge Charles went out of his way to help us with tickets. The lobby was a little small and got crowded one monrning when a larger group of people arrived. Our room was spacious and the bed very comfy. There was only one problem which was a little letdown: there was a connecting door to the room next to us and at around 4 oÂ´clock in the morning people were talking so loud, that we could not sleep any longer. It happend again once more at about the same time. Real bad. But other than that we liked it here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: patrickwNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: Hi. I recently stayed at The Hilton Boston, Financial District last night, 05 December 2008 & had a very good experience. The front desk agent, Lourdes, was kind & friendly, as were both Concierges....Charles was excellent with directions & a super nice guy! My room (732) had an amazingly comfortable king bed!!---best hotel bed ever--even tops my Four Seasons/Ritz Stays!, nice, roomy bathroom with excellent water pressure & great hot water, as well as La Source Crabtree & Evelyn bath amenties---nice smelling soaps & creams. The room also had very high ceilings, was quite spacious, offered a large desk & roomy closet with robe, iron/board, etc. The lobby is small, but boutique-y, & has two seperate entrances. I had room service for breakfast, which was good, except for a runny egg--as promised, it arrived within 30 minutes to my room (exactly). Christina, the in-room dining order taker, called me after I finished my meal just to make sure everything was well---very nice touch--they never call at luxury properties, so suprised when they called. She was very polite & a pleasure to speak with! The elevators were a little dirty, with some chipped wood (no big deal), but the room was in good shape...the tub looked ever so slightly brown(nothing big enough to call for), but I'm sure that was just usual wear-&-tear from guests. The lobby had a coffee/tea set-up in the AM, which was also nice. Good location for Fanieul Hall, etc, but about a 20-25 min. walk to Newbury Street, Beacon Hill, etc. Be sure to visit Flour Bakery, Neptune Oyster, & Stephanie's on Newbury..all great places to dine! Boston's street layout is super super confusing, so I was lost quite a bit, so be careful when navigating the city! Warmest Winter Wishes, PW, New York, NY 06 December 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NY500
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. A few blocks from Quincy market and a short subway ride to Newbury street (very nice and clean subway system). The suite was big and very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There is an affordable parking garage close by (approximately 4 blocks) at One Postal Square. It is about $9 a day. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Twobucks
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel in the heart of Boston's financial district and perfect for roaming the streets of old Boston. Our king bed room was of good size, well appointed and spotlessly clean. The staff were all eager to assist and a refreshing change to some other large city hotels at which we've stayed. One item I should mention; there is no safe in the room. Valuables have to be stored in safe boxes located with the concierge. This is not a problem except for the fact that boxes are limited in size and number. We had a great stay and can recommend this hotel to visitors wanting to see Historic Boston and the walk the Freedom Trail.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AM1979
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a brief weekend trip to Boston last weekend and stayed at the HIlton in the Financial District. What a lovely place. The staff was very pleasant. The rooms were very clean. And the beds were heavenly. The only thing I thought was a little over priced was the $38 a day parking. Nevertheless, we found that parking was expensive everywhere in Boston. The location was perfect. We were close to the Freedom Trail, Quincy Market, and many great places to eat. Need I say more! You can't go wrong with this Hilton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for first Boston Trip”
Reviews.Author: dancingvolleyballmom
Reviews.Content: I'm a Hilton Gold VIP and as such have stayed in many Hilton properties. My daughter took a semester off from college and we decided to check out Boston. This hotel was in walking distance from the major stuff, The Common, the Metro (T), waterfront, Fanueil Hall, it was awesome. Had a great room (upgrade because of the Hilton VIP) and everyone was really nice. Comfy beds and friendly staff. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “High class and noisy.”
Reviews.Author: csccat
Reviews.Content: For the most part, this hotel meets the expectations of hotels of its class: attentive staff, clean, nice amenities. I thought the Hilton Financial District would cater to business clients. I found instead that the lower floors of the building are a conference center for Northeast University. As a result, my neighbors on both nights were young adults with noisy enthusiasm commensurate with that age. To the hotel's credit, they responded promptly when I asked them to help tone down the noise after hours. For what I was paying for my room, I wanted a more peaceful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are not user friendly”
Reviews.Author: seattlerambler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice location and the staff personnel are helpful and friendly. The rooms, however, leave much to be desired. Our room was a spacious double on the 7th floor. Storage space, however, was sparse. There are only a couple of small drawers, none full-sized. There are no hooks in the bathroom, no make-up mirror, and no shelves for cosmetic bags. The oblong wastebaskets are so narrow they can't hold much. The bathroom had a loud low-flow toilet that took forever to fill. The hotel has an exercise room but it is geared toward cardiac machines and lacks a good assortment of exercise equipment, although it does have free weights. It also seems designed for tall men: I couldn't use the chin-up bar because I could barely reach it! We had stayed at 2 other hotels and 1 B&B during this trip, including one other Hilton. The rooms in this hotel seem to have been designed for beauty rather than function. We would not stay here again for that reason.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to waterfront”
Reviews.Author: 3cents
Reviews.Content: When I go into Boston, I prefer smaller, charming hotels rather than modern hotels. This one is a mix. The staff was great. There was a small line at registration but it moved rather quickly. The location was actually pretty quite during the weekend. I'm guessing it's buzzing during the week. It is in walking distance to the metro, waterfront and Faneuil Hall. Which translates to plenty of places to eat, drink and be with friends. It's a quick cab to the theatre district and the public garden but you're better off walking during commute hours. The hotel was clean, the decor in my room was lovely with dental modelings, fine drapes and cherry furniture. The linens was above average.. .that's important to me. I would stay at this location again but it does lack a spa.

Reviews.Title: “Can't praise it enough!”
Reviews.Author: WelshwomanWales
Reviews.Content: It was only a short taxi ride from the airport, and it was also only a short walk to the Aquarium and Quincy Market. I thought it was an unbeatable location. The staff were all pleasant and helpful. The room was wonderfully spacious, so much so that our next Hilton (Chicago) came as a terrible shock. Coming in after a lot of walking on a chilly afternoon, we found the complimentary hot apple cider to be a delightful and much welcomed touch. The room was perfectly clean, with an outsize bathroom. The hotel was quiet, so we got a good sleep. The breakfast was really high-quality ($22 for all you could eat) and dinner was excellent too. I really hope to visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT bed and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: IslandGirl101
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for one night before we flew out of Logan Airport. It was a great night sleep and I really have no complaints about anyhting. The manager got us a taxi in the morning because the bellhop left his post for a minute, now that is service. The heated overhang is genius! Would definately stay here again and recommend it to all!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: mystic100
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here in October 2008. Couldn't fault room or service we received. The Hilton really is in a great location, only a short walk to Fanuel Hall, the water front, the North End, the Freedom Trail and the subway. Decent sized room that was quiet and comfortable. The only problem (with a small p) was a missing "privacy" card however this arrived within 5 minutes of contacting housekeeping. The adjoining restaurant served a suberb (but slightly pricy) breakfast, with staff particularly friendly and attentive. Bottom line - doubt you'll find anywhere better as an all round package.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Mediocre Service”
Reviews.Author: littlechaos
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is in a great location. Easy walk to Fanuel Hall, the water front, the North End, the Freedom Trail and the subway. Check-in was convenient. Even though the front desk staff was proficient, it felt insincere. If I spoke Spanish they may have been more personable. They were efficient and polite just enough so you really couldn't complain but you didn't walk away feeling you were a welcome guest either. I am a Hilton Honors Silver member. I asked if that meant anything and it didn't because she didn't offer anything. I asked at the HIlton Boston Airport and got a free upgrade even though I didn't qualify. The hotel room was spacious, the beds very comfortable and the linens nice. If you left the hot water running too long in the shower, the mold on the grout would flake off. Hardly any of the ice machines worked, I had to travel several floors before finding one. The maid staff new there was no ice but obviously didn't report it to management. The A/C was practically non-existent. We called the front desk at 9:00PM to ask for an engineer but one never showed up. The front desk did call and inquire but that was the last of any front desk assistance. We saw the engineer on the elevator in the morning and asked him to check it. The only way we knew he had been there was the thermostat was lower than we left it. In order to use the elevators above floor 4, you need to slide your card. This was not explained at the desk. This hotel was popular with tour buses. Every night, I would find older couples trying to figure out how to get off on their floor. Luckily they were British and Irish and we could communicate. A good example of the lack of customer service. We left a flyer on the door for breakfast the next morning. My traveling companion didn't put the room number on it. The person collecting the cards obviously didn't check for that information. It was that lack of attention that makes this hotel just okay. Luckily we got a corporate rate of $209 a night. If I had paid more, I would have been very disappointed. Even though the hotel was in a great location, I won't return. The service was just mediocre and left me feeling like just another paying customer. If you didn't ask for a service it wasn't offered and if you didn't report a problem, it wasn't addressed. Nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service in Boston”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowJockStew
Reviews.Content: The accommodation was good. The location central. What clinched it was the helpfulness of the staff from the Door to the Desk to the Restaurant. Unusually the breakfast was well staffed with a speedy service (as an option to the buffet).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZiggyIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. within walking distance to a lot of bars and restaurants. rooms were nice, modern and very clean. Valet parking was expensive but probably the norm in the area! Concierge never at their desk! We always had to wait a while, looked like they were a bit short of staff!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, the beds were comfy...”
Reviews.Author: marki50uk
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here after flying from the UK, before we went off down to Cape Cod. The previous reviews are correct, the rooms are fine but the beds are excellent. We sometimes have a job sleeping after arriving at a holiday destination... not here! Very good location as well, plenty of nightlife around, if you want a smoke try the Irish bar on the corner, it has a big outdoor area. Handy for the seafront and lots of restaurants too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: JoPCt
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Staff was extremely friendly and eager to help without even being asked. Got an unexpected room upgrade and were extremely impressed with the decor, cleanliness, and soundproofing. The breakfast buffet was delicious but a little overpriced ($22 for adults, but a bargain for child ($5.50)). Would stay here again and recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Hoboken Traveller
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review not because I had any complaint about the Hilton's property but because I think the reviews on this site are slightly misleading. When I read them, I had expected the hotel to be of the level you might expect of a Ritz or a Four Seasons. It isn't, it is just a very good Hilton, showing all the good things of a high end Hilton and no criticisms but just not a five star hotel. The beds are comfy, the bathrooms great, the service fine. The public areas are limited though, which is partly why I don't belive it is a 5 star hotel. The bar next door, Mr Dooleys, was FANTASTIC!!! I can not recommend it highly enough for friendly excellent service and really good Irish breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Comfiest bed ever”
Reviews.Author: Gillyliz
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after a trouble free journey from the UK. The service throughout was excellent. The room was spacious with everything we needed . The bed was so so comfy it was difficult to get up and face the day. The restaurant in the hotel was very good with a wide ranging dinner and breakfast menu. The caesar salad was one of the best I have ever tasted. The hotel was situated within easy walking distance of the Quincy Market area and we would recommend the Old Town Trolley Tour to see the sights and get your bearings.

Reviews.Title: “i liked this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: efdhozman
Reviews.Content: i thought this hotel was very reasonable in price and a good location. it was walking distance to faniel hall and the harbour. i thought the rooms were nice and updated. the staff seemed confused when we would call down and ask them questions, but overall, i liked the hotel. nice restaraunt inside, pricey but nice. there was 4 of us in our room and it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: lambley
Reviews.Content: We booked this at an excellent rate through unpackaged.com and we unsure as to what we would find. It proved to be just right for our 3 night stay in Boston being a very easy walk to most of the sights and just a short walk from Aquarium subway station. If you like Irish Pubs then this is the place to be - we would particularly recommend Mr Dooleys which is virtually next-door to the Hilton. Our room was a decent size and well appointed, but don't expect a view for the price we paid! The bed was very comfortable and the A/C worked well. Staff were efficient and courteous and I would particularly like to thank the conceirge who stored our luggage for a couple of days whilst we took a trip to Washington.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was excellent”
Reviews.Author: step_ott
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here for two nights, a Thursday and Friday. Everything went smoothly from check-in to check-out. Valet parking was very quick, there was an envelope that had a note from the reservations clerk and all the tickets that were promised with our package included. We didn't have to ask for anything. Breakfast was very good and served in a pleasant setting. The hotel was located in a good spot for Faneuil hall, the aquarium, and as a starting point for walks around town. Our room was excellent - it had two rooms, lots of space, very nice furnishings and it was in very good condition.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Jennie018
Reviews.Content: Small but very well appointed room & lovely, spacious bathroom with lots of space for toiletries on granite countertop. Loved the buffet - we were going to go out for breakfast because of the price ($22) but after a lazy start because of the wonderful, comfortable bed, (although pillows softer than I like) we changed our minds - so glad we did. The service was a bit patchwork at times but the food quality was good. Unlike many hotel buffets, the food actually tasted! Flavorsome fruit, wonderful smoked salmon & delicious lemon honey, creamy HOT scrambled egg - well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: smerrill1
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect location for a weekend getaway for me and my girlfriend. Hotel was very clean and beds were adorned with a down comforter and 6 down pillows! The heavy drapes were very good at keeping out the sunlight which allowed us to sleep in a little longer. There are tons of bars and shops within walking distance including Quincy Market and the waterfront attractions. Subway (T) is a few blocks away and easily accessible. The Concierge was helpful and the Bell hops were on the ball and abundant . The front desk was OK but I never got the warm and fuzzies from them. Room service was quick with a breakfast of fresh berries, muffins and hot coffee. The North End was a fairly short T ride to North Station and a quick walk from there. A must if you like homemeade italian cooking. The whole area feels like a street carnival on a weekend night. Lots of fun. Overall I would definitely stay here again. The only problem we experienced was the constant whirling of the AC unit outside below the window. If you remember, ask for a room away from the hotels AC unit. It's not a huge problem or deal breaker, just more of a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for sightseeing and Business”
Reviews.Author: lacuadra
Reviews.Content: July 18-20 I arrived at 12:00 and my room was ready and very comfortable. Ah you have got to love the Hilton bed. The Hotel is three blocks from Faneuil Hall and either State or Aquarium T station. Hint: if you are in just to stay in Boston, forget the car, this hotel is perfect and convenient. Staff was helpful and even kept my luggage until 5pm on my last day.

Reviews.Title: “Great access to city sights”
Reviews.Author: XmarkstheScot
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room, quiet at night (we were on the 15th floor though). Great location, within a few blocks of Quincy Market and Faneuil Hall, and T stations for futher afield places. Friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: Cambs11
Reviews.Content: Excellent location to tour the city, Helpful concierge. Good Choice at breakfast. Nice sized room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for a Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: rayjay80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton in the Financial District for one night after our cruise ended in Boston. We wanted a nice hotel with a reasonable rate for a weekend night in a downtown location. This was a good choice. We got a room on the top floor but it did not have much of a view. The bed was extremely comfortable with numerous pillows. Their location is excellent. Within walking distance of most downtown attractions and several subway stops. After dinner we felt very safe walking back to the hotel after dark. Our only complaint is that the front desk would not give us the room key until exactly 3:00pm, their check-in time. I approached the desk at 2:50 and they made us wait the ten minutes until the official check-in time. Their concierge, John, was very helpful. He made us reservations at a great Italian restaurant in the North End (Saraceno's) and even printed our airline boarding passes for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GFRCPA
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Boston before was looking for a better hotel at a good price. When this came up as the best price was a little worried about the location from looking at the online map, BUT THE LOCATION IS GREAT. We could, and did, walk to everywhere. Not sure why it was so cheap (was a weekend stay) but it was one of the cleanest hotels I have stayed in. The room was very good size by any standard. The financial district seemed safer than other parts of the city, light traffic. Subway and harbor less than 5 minute walk away, shops and restaurants, bars all around. We skipped the hotel valet parking @ $38 a day and found all-day weekend parking for $9.00 per day, 2 blocks away at the Postal Square garage. We never took the car out for the whole weekend. Never eat at the hotel but breakfast was cheap at the nice Panera Bread 1 block away. Hotel bar nice for an upscale place for a drink. Staff were great with advice and maps on where to go and all very polite. For a person that travels a lot I don't easily give out excellent marks but in my opinion they earned it especially at the rate we paid. If I come back to Boston this is where I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lollypoplady
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 Lovely Nights wished it could have been more. The beds are extremely comfortable and went to sleep easily unlike many hotel beds. The room and bathroom were both a very good size. Both were extremely well kept and clean. We had a corner room which i believe is slighlty larger then a regular room and has more natural light. The hotel is near quincy market and south station ect and most of the main attractions are wthin a five min walk. For breakfast quciny market has some options, there are a couple of near by delis and a place called panera bread has wonderful tasting bagels. The only thing about the hotel is that it is not very well light and as we waled at night form the station it took a little to find even though it has 2 entrances. Also for a modern room a flatscreen tv would have fitted in a bit better but the one we had worked fine. Overall i would completley come back and would stay here over any of the hotels near the pru as i feel that this is a nicer location in boston to stay esp for fisrst time visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Average and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl5555
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Hilton in the Boston Financial District. It definitely had it's good points and bad points. The entire staff was very polite and helpful. The hotel was in a great location, and my coworkers and I were able to walk to dinner and shopping nearby. My room had a beautiful comfortable bed, but... My room was on the 4th floor directly above a giant air conditioning unit on a lower roof of the hotel. The unit hummed all night and I regretted not packing a sleep aid! I asked about using a business center to print out my boarding passes. The business center (2 computers and 1 printer) charged a minimum of $10 to get online. If a patron is paying $349 per night, being able to use a business center to print out a boarding pass and check flight status should be free and not at an additional charge. I also found the hotel a bit dark because of the decor (mustard yellow & green patterned carpeting). Overall, it was adequate lodging for a business trip, but I've stayed in better for less.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but....”
Reviews.Author: johnsodz
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and is in a great location for business and tourism. We stayed for two night for a friends wedding. The staff was very nice. You had to use your room key to use the elevator and lavatories on the lobby level, which was a pain, but it also keeps the hotel secure. Our room was nice and big (bigger than some other hotels in the area). We had only one complaint. We had problems with our toilet, it ran and clogged for no apparent reason. They supposedly fixed it to only clog again. Our friends who also stayed at the hotel has toilet problems as well. We would go back if they can fix their plumbing issues!!!

Reviews.Title: “close to the markets”
Reviews.Author: travel_the_world2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hilton for 2 nights and this hotel is very close to the market where all the tourists go for a meal/bar shopping/entertainment. room was very nice larger room/nice bed... the usual hilton style... only disappointing thing was the view out of the window... the air con! also you had to use your room card for the lift... i am not sure if this buliding is also for resident... but with 4 cases and trying to do the lift was difficult. Otherwise great hotel central located, near a subway and near lots of places to eat and drink at night.

Reviews.Title: “A big hit with all the family (adults)”
Reviews.Author: salmon08
Reviews.Content: Date: June 6, 2008 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Bath UK We used the hotel for a reunion involving family members travelling from Milwaukee, Bath and Hebden Bridge - all arriving on different dates. The hotel exceeded our expectations. A great location close to the T, waterfront, good restaurants and shops. No car required! The concierge service was excellent. Unobtrusive but efficient restaurant staff led to a relaxed atmosphere. Rooms were clean and spacious. If we had to make one negative observation - an ounce of charm on the part of the reception staff would not go amiss. We have no reservation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and inviting, great location”
Reviews.Author: Watthree
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Boston Hilton Financial District over Memorial Day weekend and was very pleased with the experience. From the time I arrived to the time I checked out, all staff members were pleasant, courteous and efficient. Check in was quick and painless. My room, on the 8th floor, had a nice view and was very spacious. The room and bath were both spotless and the common areas were in great shape as well. The bed and pillows were terrific and I got a great night's sleep. The location is very convenient to transportation and sight seeing and there were plenty of bars and restaurants to choose from nearby. I thought that being in the financial district, it would be dead during the weekend but there was plenty of activity around. Some of the lunch/breakfast places were closed, but many of the restaurants were open. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: FemaleTraveler
Reviews.Content: I am finding more and more that the Hilton chain is also inconsistent. Some of them look great and treat you well. I stayed at this one only to try a new hotel in Boston after the Langham and the Westin Waterfront. This hotel was bland and unexciting. Although the staff do treat you nicely and try to remember your name (appreciated), the room (two doubles) was small and there was no view and did not have a "nice hotel" feel to it. I suppose it may be too much to ask a downtown hotel. There seemed to be many "priceline" guests, and so though it is in a business district, the clientele seemed less businesslike. The Langham around the corner had more of an upscale feel to it. Adequate, but I probably would either go back to the Langham or try something else.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, nice location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cla114
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my Hilton points, so did not pay, however the hotel is absolutely nice, way above the average hiltons, in a great location, and with super-efficient staff. When I arrived I asked if there was a microwave oven in the room, they said no but they immediately brought one in the room. The room was spacious, modern. The bathroom was very nice, with a very nice shower and bath tub. The porter and valet service (quite expensive, true) are super-efficient, really great. I don't know about other hotels in Boston but I would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: treanbean
Reviews.Content: Was awarded the room thru Priceline for $135/night. Was hoping for the Intercontinental but this was fine. The staff was very friendly and efficient. Upgraded one night's stay to a suite for an extra $75 - my husband's birthday. The suite was nice, very spacious, but considering the inconvenience of changing rooms I wouldn't do it again. The non-suite room we moved to for the last two nights of our stay was a very large room so it would have sufficed perfectly. Extremely clean. We spent very little time in the room. I loved the proximity of everything in the Financial District. We bought Trolley tickets but got off at stop 4 and just walked everywhere - and I am not a walker. With our suite upgrade were free tickets to the buffet that they charge $19.95. Do not waste your money on the buffet. The food is unbelievable expensive in the restaurant. There is a Panera Bread just down the road and plenty of little shops to get a bite to eat. Quincy Market, North End all within walking distance. There is a restaurant on the way to Quincy Hall, Bertucci's, that was magnificant - not so expensive and casual but I would go there again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: lynchdabreu
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to arrive at the doors of this hotel. We were met by efficient and friendly porters and quickly processed through check in. As it was our engagement celebration, I had asked for a card to be placed in the room for my partner and the staff went out of their way to make our stay special. Nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were spacious and impecably clean. The breakfast buffet was great, as there were a lot of healthy items as well as the usual pancakes & muffins etc. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to friends and colleagues. You are guaranteed to have a stress free stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sjl96
Reviews.Content: We loved just about everything at this Hilton. We were given a free room upgrade upon arrival so we had a very large 2 room suite. The location was very convienent for exploring downtown Boston. The hotel restaurant had a good breakfast. Room was very clean and check-in was quick and easy. We would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: hurleyk12
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome! My boyfriend surprised me with a weekend getaway for my birthday. Everyone we met was friendly and helpful. They do have valet for $38 a night however we chose to park one block down in a garage thinking it would be cheaper and it ended upbeing $44...should have gone with the valet. When we first arrived we checked in and realized we didn't have a smoking room...we knew we would definitely want to smoke the more champagne we drank so we called the front desk and they already had a key made for us by the time we took the elevator down to the lobby. The beds I would have to say put the trip over the top!!! They are specially made from Serta for the Hilton and we have already gone to the hilton website to buy the bed and down mattress covering...you'll see what I mean when you get there,,,incredible. The hotel is conveniently located to the aquarium, quincy market, tons of pubs and restaurants. I would definitely go there again and would recommend it to anyone I know that wants to spend a little extra for the little details and finer things....even the shampoo is terrific!! Everyone should try this place at least once. After this trip, we are considering a move to Boston!!

Reviews.Title: “I felt harassed!”
Reviews.Author: jmh08
Reviews.Content: They ruined a very important event for my best friend! We picked this hotel for it's location but in the end was not worth it! We were harassed by security in the middle of the night for no reason and then again the next moring by a mini bar checker???? Very weird I have never even heard of such a person, i refused to let him in since we were checking out and he would be able to come in right after. When we complained at check out they could have cared less!!! If you are looking to come to the city to have a fun girls get away weekend look somewhere else!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: IMJustVisiting
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for four nights. We had some trouble finding the place with all the crazy streets that comprise Boston, but were very happy with the place once we settled in. The hotel is conveniently located reasonably near the State and Aquarium stops on the subway line (which is the best way to get around in Boston), Faneuil Hall Marketplace, Government Center, and the Boston Aquarium (excellent and well worth the trip). If the weather is reasonable, it is also within a nice walk of Boston Common, Boston Garden (Make Way for Ducklings), and upscale shopping on Newberry and Boylston Streets. Our room was very comfortable in the nicely refurbished 1920's Art Deco building. The hotel had an excellent small restaurant with a fine buffet breakfast - free to Hilton Gold members. The hotel staff were uniformly attentive and pleasant. We enjoyed several nearby restaurants: Sakurabana (Japanese, of course), Black Rose (Irish Pub), Legal Seafoods (nearest is at Long Wharf), in addition to many eating options at Faneuil Hall. I would happily return to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Cosiest Bed Ever!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyJetSetter
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend came to Boston from Ireland for St. Patrick's Day and the Hilton was the perfect place to stay.. the room was huge for the both of us, the bed could have fit three people and the pillows were so comfy I would have brought them home if they would have fit in my suitcase! Overall a great place to stay and I would definately go back! Dont eat Hershey's...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotelÂ¬”
Reviews.Author: jessandtony
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from 21st-25th March 2008 and cannot fault the hotel at all! The location is perfect - within 3 blocks of quincy market and some fantastic bars/restaurants and lots of shops, yet the hotel is in a really quiet street which feels a million miles away from the tourist centre. It's also close to the freedom trail and boston common and very accessible from the airport (2 stops on the 'T' and a very short walk). Check in staff were very accommodating and welcoming...much needed after 2 hours at immigration! We were upgraded to an extremely spacious and well equipped suite, which had everything you could possibly want from a hotel, other than perhaps a good view - surrounded by tall buildings. The hotel staff were quick to meet any of our needs - more towels and milk for coffee, at any time of day. The bed was huge and very comfortable and the bathroom very clean. We didn't really use any other hotel facilities, although there is a lovely library off of the lobby and the restaurant looked lovely. Concierge was very helpful looking after our bags after check out until we were ready to leave for the airport. When we go back to Boston, this is the only hotel we will consider! We got a very cheap deal with trailfinders - 3 nights for Â£160 for the 2 of us.

Reviews.Title: “CAUTION CAUTION CAUTION”
Reviews.Author: bostonmas
Reviews.Content: Caution! Caution! Caution! This hotel is lovely and in a very conventient location, however, if you want to sleep at night before 3am, don't bother staying here. We got to our hotel at about 9:45 pm, crawled into bed as we had an early departure out of the city, and all we could hear was the music from the bar across the street and people out on the street. We called the front desk at about midnight to ask for a resolve and they said they wasn't anything they could do as we were the first to complain. We called the front desk again at 1:30am and asked if they had any earplugs and was just told no. If you stay at this hotel, make sure your room is not across from Mr. Dooley's Bar and higher up than the 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “ruined our trip”
Reviews.Author: glesgatraveller
Reviews.Content: I will not detail the problems we had with this hotel but they ruined what could have been a great time, there was a mess up with our booking which the desk was not very helpful with at all, the cleanliness of the room left alot to be desired, and the bar staff have some scam going which i couldnt quite figure out and neither could there boss, i will say the concierge and door staff were very helpful. if staying in this area then the sports bar next to the aquarium t station is well worth a visit, decent drinks and good food with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic room; rude staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Zoe8316
Reviews.Content: I am surprised to see all the reviews of this hotel describing their large rooms. Our experience was not pleasant. We came to Boston to celebrate St Patrick's Day with my sister who lives in Boston. My sister and her son came with us as we checked in. A rude young woman at the desk smirked to my husband in mock surprise "oh, your family is very large", implying that we were trying to stuff extra people into the room. We should have left the hotel at that point! Our room was very small (even by Manhattan standards!) and very dark- overlooking an interior alleyway. Our ceiling light had a naked bulb -- I asked for a globe to cover it as soon as we entered the room - but when we returned 4 hours later it was still not done. After a second request they finally fixed it. The tub drain did not work properly either. We picked this hotel for the excellent location,but I will never stay there again. Our overall impression was that it was an old, dark, cramped and aging building with creaking elevators and rude staff. There are other hotels in the vicinity that are a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff and great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: game_mom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention in early March. Great view of Boston Harbor from my room on the 15th floor. Huge room with super comfy bed. Very quiet! Hotel bar was posh and the drink prices reflected that, but it is downtown Boston. Hotel bar closed at 11:30pm, but the staff was very helpful in helping us find some cheaper, more relaxed places to hang out that were very close by. Even on weeknights some of the local dance/karaoke places were hoppin'. Had room service for breakfast and it arrived quickly and everything was still hot. Only complaint was the limited table space (small round table next to bed full of stuff and a cluttered desk). Not really convenient for eating in your room. Everything was very clean and the shower and bath fixtures looked brand new (Kohler). Elegant lobby and brass finishings everywhere. After checking out (and reaching home 5 hours later), I realized that I left something. The cleaning staff could not find it, but said they would check in the laundry area. Got a call the next day. Great service!

Reviews.Title: “Boston in the snow”
Reviews.Author: love2shop35
