There was a small kitchen area with a coffee maker, 2 tea bags, 1 decaf coffee, 1 reg coffee, 2 cremoras and one stirrer 2 coffee cups. Remind you there are three adults. We wondered why they even put a dining table in the room as there were no microwave, utensils, nothing. We had bought some treats from the wonderful "Mike's Bakery" in the North end and had to eat with our fingers. The ice machine was broken on our floor, however it was repaired in a few hours. We called downstairs for extra towels, cups, glasses and possible utensils, got the first three but no utensils. We then inquired about our complimentary beverage and snack and were told that we would receive it at 6pm. we left for the play @7:15 still nothing and nothing waiting for us on our return at 11pm. Readied ourselves for bed, holes in the pillow cases, dingy looking. Up at the crack of dawn when construction noise woke us . We were on the fifteenth floor and could still hear it. This of course is not the hotel's fault. Off to breakfast..very good buffet. Explained to hostess that our breakfast was included she nodded and we ate and upon leaving we were chased down by a waiter demanding payment. I had to go to the front desk for"vouchers" we never received. At the front desk was told we did not have breakfast included but free admission to the aquarium. After a while they said we did have free breakfast but for 2 adults 1 child. This took more time as I explained I had paid $149.00 extra for the third adult and another $75 for the "suite" and I better get breakfast paid. To get through all this I went through 3 people as these folks don't know how to multi-task (I can't do that..you'll have to see....). The Lion King was wonderful and the seats we had were great, the view from our room overlooked the harbor but the price was just to inflated for what was received. We have stayed in many Boston hotels and we will not be staying at this one again. ANd if you are looking for Lion King packages the Omni Parker House has a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Wyndham”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham lived up to our expectations! We stayed at the hotel three night in mid-July. Boston seems to be a town with a lot of nightlife and the Wyndham Boston sits on quiet Broad Street, sheltering you from all the noise. There was construction, but it is all over Boston. We walked literally everywhere - to Hanover Street restaurants in Little Italy, to all the Freedom Trail sites, to the Aquarium (great to visit!) - we only used the subway for locations way out. There was also a little 24 hour grocery within walking distance. The hotel had several elevators and they were very quick! We did not have a car (waited until we were leaving Boston to rent one!), so we did not use the parking. The staff was very friendly and helpful in giving us restaurant and site seeing ideas. We were traveling with two adults and two teenagers who all stayed in the same room. The room was very large and very beautifully decorated, I just wish they would use some of that room to have queen size beds instead of doubles. That would have to be our only negative on this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Turbofletch75
Reviews.Content: After making reservations for the weekend before the DNC, I realized that the least I would be paying per night for a nice hotel in Boston was $200. However, after reading the reviews about the Wyndham, I figured I would see what I could do to stay there - I am so glad I did. I ended up paying only $130 per night - amazing!! Not only the price was great, but the staff, room and location was perfect. Lesson learned: you don't have to stay at the "famous" hotels, in fact most have poor service anymore. The next time I am in Boston - I will only consider the Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “Truly one of the best hotels Boston has to offer”
Reviews.Author: shawnie27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Wyndham Boston during our most recent visit to the Boston area, July 22-25, 2004. The staff more than exceeded my expectations, they had the 3p's that I look for when traveling:prompt, polite and positive. The accomodations were extremely spacious and impeccable, truly a delightful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had an awesome stay at the Wyndham Boston! The hotel location is perfect, walking distance to pretty much everything! We booked the family package at a great rate of $199, which included a two-room suite, breakfast buffet for four, aquarium tickets, free in-room movie or playstation time with delivery of popcorn and soda, and late (3:00PM) checkout. We checked in early and our room was already ready. All staff were very friendly! Our suite was very nice! You can tell they recently renovated. Bathroom was also very nice and was a good size. I like the way they set it up- the shower and toilet are in one room, while the sink is seperate. The beds were very comfortable as well! We were on the fourth floor, and there was barely any street noise. Breakfast buffet in their nice restaurant was delicious! The only real downside to this hotel is that they don't have a pool. But with everything to see and do in Boston, there's really no need for one. I definitely recommend this hotel to everone, and I WILL return the next time I visit Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, treated us like kings & queens”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough good things about the Wyndham Boston Hotel. We had a beautiful room, excellent service, and pleasant staff. The breakfast was delicious and included in our price. We received AAA discount. Close to many Boston attractions. We would revisit this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “beware the building site opposite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel 5 stars, but we had a front facing room, with lovely glimpses of the waterfront and river.However opposite was a building site which started with jack hammers and pneumatic drills at 6am during the week.The windows were not well soundproofed so sleep was impossible The room itself was roomy comfortable with a llovely bathroom.The staff too were friendly and helpful.Situation wise it was perfect with everything close either on foot or via the "T"

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: mpcasey
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two night in May and we had a wonderful time. The staff is so friendly and helpful! The location is perfect near everything. The hotel is clean and roomy. We will stay here again on our next trip

Reviews.Title: “Good location + Rooms but expensive?”
Reviews.Author: dongley
Reviews.Content: Good location, can't fault the staff or rooms If you're on a budget though there are probably other hotels that will suffice but if you want luxury this will do you fine

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelguru4u
Reviews.Content: The location is GREAT! The room was modern and very clean. The lobby was small and plain. It was an slightly above average stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: MCIFARETTO
Reviews.Content: Had a one night stay in July of 2003 and what a suprise we had. We had a corner room with a view of the city and water. At night the view was out of this world and could't keep the window treatments closed. The room was very large for myself, my wife and the kids and the room extras (Large desk, movies ,robes, free cookies, soda, and water was great) Note: sign up as a Wyndham member before you book to get the upgrade and free stuff. Staff was great anf the walk to the historic area was very close and no problem at all. All in all we will be back soon for more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dinahcat
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent four wonderful days at the Wyndham Boston and have nothing but the highest praise for the hotel and the staff. The room was lovely and quite large. The staff were helpful with directions and kept our bags for us after checkout so we could spend the morning in the North End wandering around and enjoying ourselves without having to drag luggage with us. Having Wyndham By Request was an added bonus. We will be back just as soon as we can. Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to every good review!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I recently spent three nights at the Wyndham Boston. The hotel lived up to every good review I read before booking the trip. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed that I ever slept in. The bathroom was very nice, marble counter tops and very clean. Our view wasn't the best, our window looked across the to the other rooms of the hotel, there are some rooms that look onto the harbor. The entire staff was very courteous and helpful. The concierge was invaluable. The three different people working at the concierge desk were all very knowledgeable and gave us several good recommendations for restaurants. The only downfall to this hotel is that parking is $32/day, a little on the expensive side. If you fly into Boston this is a very good hotel and worth the price of the rooms, which were nicely priced after our AAA discount.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel! My family spent the weekend in Boston and was fortunate to stay at The Wyndham Boston. Our room was large and comfortable. The service was impecable. The food at the restaraunt was very good. The concierge was very accomodating and went out of his way to make sure that our needs were met. We have stayed in Wyndham Hotels in other cities, but none can top this one. We will certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Noisey Hotel, Neighborhood and Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: RhodeIslandPam
Reviews.Content: We found out late at night that the clubs empty out and there is so much noise we couldnt sleep. The front desk said that they couldnt do anything about it and said it happens on the weekends. We asked to move our room and they said no and it didnt matter as it was all around us. No bellman to help us move and no doorman to help get a taxi to airport. We wont be staying at Wyndham when we come back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lauriebelle
Reviews.Content: Did much online research for a place to stay in Boston for two nights midweek. Would have loved to stay at XV Beacon or Nine Zero. Got a little scared, though, when I saw the prices at XV Beacon and how small people said the rooms were at Nine Zero. The Wyndham worked out just great though. I was able to narrow down a rate on Hotwire of $88.00 per night!! This was after finding the next lowest rate of $137 on Wyndham. I did join Wyndham by Request and asked to have the number applied to my Hotwire reservation. I received a lovely e-mail from the Wyhdham by Request manager telling me this would be no problem. And how much she looked forward to meeting us when we checked in. When we checked in, we didn't seem to have the "personal touch" that we expected of the front desk staff or food/drink in the room. There was a well stocked mini bar. And when we had a few items from there, the charges did not show up on the bill. So I guess I'm not sure how the program is supposed to work. I thought we'd have things specifically laid out for us. Or that we would have had a note or comment from the front desk. The bartender, Scott, is fabulous. Didn't have a chance to eat in the restaurant. The parking is expensive at $32.00 per night. But we just parked at check-in and walked the town. There is unlimited in and out of the garage, though, when you valet, if you do decide to use your car. Boston is a walking town, though. And the T service is great for getting around. All in all, a great place to stay. Would definitely stay again and recommend it. I want to amend my review posted on February 9. My rating of the Wyndham Boston has improved!! I sent an e-mail to Wyndham ByRequest in response to their survey about our stay. I mentioned that I was confused by what I felt to be inconsistency with the ByRequest program. It turns out that hotels booked on Hotwire do not qualify for ByRequest amentities. I did receive credit for the stay to my account. But the special price I got on Hotwire meant that the ByRequest benefits did not apply. Once again, I received a very nice e-mail from the ByRequest manager explaining this. I will definitely look to the Wyndham for my first choice of lodging on any future trips!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Boston Downtown / Financial District
HotelInfo.Address: 89 Broad Street, Boston, MA 02110
